loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more crates of soft drinks and more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Kyeshero Bikoguze Group-Rukungiri

texts.en: Alex M. is a 36-year-old father of three and he belongs to Kyeshero Bikoguze Group-Rukungiri. 18 years is the time he has been working hard at his retail shop enterprise in Matumba. He says he also sells coffee to supplement his profits. 200,000 shillings is what totals up as monthly generated earnings for him. With this loan he says he is going to restock his retail shop with additional purchases of mercandise that he says he will resell and as such make more profits.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail stock for resale

loans.name: Kigunda Bakyara Twekambe Group 2-Rukungiri

texts.en:
32 year old T. Amos says close friends prevailed upon him to start up his retail business 10 years ago in Kanoko-Rukungiri. It a business that brings this diligent gentleman 180,000 shillings weekly. 

Amos, for the most part, sells general merchandise ranging from sugar, beans, rice, salt, soap, etc.  Before he ventured into this business, his thoughts were more preoccupied with a small farming business that he still maintains alongside another modest side business in the form of a payphone. Amos is happily married. He has 5 kids, 4 of whom are pursuing their education with vigor. With this loan he says he is going to purchase more general merchandise retail stock for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more general merchandise retail stock for resales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To add more money to his business.

loans.name: Kigunda Bakyara Twekambe Group 1-Rukungiri

texts.en: 50 year old K. Joy belongs to Kigunda Bakyara Twekambe group 1- Rukungiri. She is a widow and has 9 kids. She preoccupies herself with farming as a source of livelihood. She does her farming in Kanonko cell-Rukungiri. To get started in this business 8 years ago, she used savings from her poultry enterprise. Each month this business generates her KES 200,000. With this loan she says she is going to buy manure to improve her banana plantation.

loans.use: The purchase of more manure to improve her banana plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more body lotion and lady's clothes.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: T. Francis is a 46 year old business man who has, for the last 3 years, been operating a small cinema hall business in Bwambara-Rukungiri. In a month, this business generates him KES 100,000. Francis is married and has 6 kids. Francis is also a teacher and he says his small savings helped him a lot in getting started as he was able to buy furniture and other needed equipment. With this loan he says he is going to pay for the education costs of his kids.

loans.use: The education costs for his kids.

loans.name: Sefako Ayaba

texts.fr: Madame est mariée avec un enfant. Elle est âgée de 30 ans et s’est spécialisée dans le commerce des produits cosmétique.Elle a associé plus tard la vente de boissons. Elle a débuté en 2009 cette activité.  Elle s’approvisionne  à Lomé et revend en détail à côté de la pharmacie djidjolé. Avec le prêt demandé, elle compte acheter 4 cartons de produit cosmétique  et 2 cartons de boissons pour faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: Mrs. A. is married and has one child.  She is 30 years old.  She originally specialized in sales of cosmetics, then she added sales of drinks.  She started her business in 2009.  She buys her supplies in Lomé and sells at the retail level beside the Djidjolé pharmacy.  With this loan, she expects to buy four cases of cosmetic products and two cases of drinks to meet the ever growing demand for these products.

loans.use: Cosmetic products business

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is a young mother and wife – she has three daughters and three sons. Hana's husband works with the Palestinian NationA. Authority. The family owns a small bookstore in the city selling books, stationary, gift items and accessories. Hana wants to improve the business by selling more variety; therefore, Hana came to FATEN for a loan to purchase stationary and books.

Hana's son, Ziyad, appears in the picture as Hana comes from a conservative background.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
 
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the culturA. context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principA. loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase books and stationary

loans.name: Kabatuura Women's Group-Bushenyi

texts.en: K. Gaudy belongs to Kabatuura Women’s group- Bushenyi. She is happily married with four kids and she operates a pub in Kahija.  Before she ventured into this business, four years ago , she was selling local brew. 150,000 shillings is what accrues to her business as weekly profits. Gaudy also sells bananas to supplement what she earns from her pub business. She says with this loan she is going to restock her bar with more crates of drinks for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more crates of drinks for her pub

loans.name: Tukwatanise Women's Group-Bushenyi

texts.en: N. Venny is affliated with Tukwatanise Women’s group . She is 41 years old and has five kids. It is now six years since she began her photocopy business in Bushenyi. Venny was formerly a teacher. She describes herself as hard-working and self-driven. 200,000 shillings is what accrues to her business monthly. With this loan she says she is going to buy more printing paper and cartridges.

loans.use: The purchase of more printing paper and cartridges

loans.name: Bubaare Bakyara Tukwatanise Group-Ibanda

texts.en: 60-year-old N. Kiviri belongs to Bubaare Bakyara Tukwatanise group-Ibanda. She is married with five kids. She has been running her  lucrative goat sales business for 15 years in Jubilee-Ibanda. With earnings from this business, she has in many respects sustained her family over the years as regards improved welfare. 150,000 shillings is what her business generates weekly. With this loan she says she is going to purchase more goats to fatten for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more goats to fatten for resale

loans.name: Dorine Atieno

texts.en:
Dorine A., 32 years old, is from Katito area and is married to George. They have seven children who are all school-going between the ages of 12 and two years old.

Dorine has a basketry business that she has been working at for the past six years. Her monthly income comes to Kshs 7,000. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully completing the first one. She is in need of basketry raw materials and thus the need for applying for a loan to enable her to buy them. She hopes to use the profits made to improve her business and also pay school fees for her children.

Her desire is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: Buy raw materials for basketry

loans.name: Kinyugunyu Turibamwe Group-Ibanda

texts.en: B. John is 49 years old and a father of seven. His longevity in his farming and agro-produce sales businesses stretches to a period of 30 years. It is been a chequered experience throughout these years of operation, but he is quick to add that his perseverance and strong-hearted attitude have been winners for him. His business is located at Kinyigunyu. 80,000 is what he says accrues to his business weekly. John says it is his parents who inspired him to begin this business. With this loan he says he is going to buy more land to expand his farming activities. He belongs to Kinyugunyu Turibamwe Group- Ibanda.

loans.use: The purchase of more land to expand his farming business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah O. is 48 years old and from Katito. She is a widow with five children; Bob 20 years, Samuel 17 years, Minnie 13 years and Valentine 11 years old.

Sarah has a basketry business that she has operated for the past two years and has seen her business grow during that time. She has orders for  making more baskets and is in need of the raw materials. She is applying for a loan from KADET LTD. She intends to use the profits made to pay school fees for her children and also cater for the family's upkeep.

Her desire is to see her business grow further and be able to have as many clients as possible.

loans.use: Buy raw materials for making baskets

loans.name: Kuteesa Women's Group-Mpigi

texts.en:
Animal husbandry has been 35 year old N. Harriet’s business for the last 20 years. Her business is located in Ssazi-Mpigi. Harriet, who describes herself as highly ambitious, says she began this business with savings from her erstwhile farming business. This was after she came to terms with the fact that there was a ready market for cattle, goats and pigs within her operating area.  

Harriet isa single mother with 3 kids. She says her brother has been at her beck and call in the running of her business all this while. She also ekes out profits from a small cash crop selling business. Harriet is also a teacher.  In a week her profits total up to 150,000 shillings. With this loan Harriet, who belongs to Kuteesa women’s group- Mpigi, says she is going to purchase building materials for the school she says she is building in her locality.

loans.use: The purchase of building materials for her up and coming school

loans.name: Bring Amber Court To Unite Group 3-Jinja

texts.en:
38 year old W. Mudasiru is an "Amber Court Unite" group member. Most, if not all, of the group’s members carryout their business operations in the amber court market.  W.’s start up story reads like a page from the other members who are heading the other sub groups in the Amber Court Unite group. 

He started in his current fish sells business with savings from a modest silver fish sells enterprise. Prior to that he had tried his hand at agriculture. W. who is to all appearances a diligently focused man says his weekly business earnings sum up to 80,000 shillings. W. is happily married with 6 kids, 5 of whom attend school. With this loan he says he is going to purchase more fish for resell and the rest will go towards paying school fees for his kids.

loans.use: The purchase of more fish to resell and pay school fees for his kids

loans.name: Dinay Onyango

texts.en:
Dinah Anyango is 59 years old and from the from Sondu area. She is married to Walter and they have four children who are adults. The first born is 30 years old and the last is 18 years old.

Dinah runs a butcher shop which has lasted for the past 15 years. Her monthly income is Kshs 10,000. She has applied for a loan of Kshs 10,000 which she wants to use to buy more meat and add to her stock. Her clients consist mostly of the people who live around her butcher shop and also the local hotels.

Her desire is to see her business expand and be able to employ one person to help her run the butcher shop.

loans.use: Buy meat supplies for her butcher shop

loans.name: Bring Ambercourt To Unite Group 2-Jinja

texts.en: Farming was 40 year old Poul Wangol ’s first business preoccupation. Poul still does farming but for the last 4 years, he has preeminently been growing onions. Before he used to grow a variety of cash crops but, at length, he made a deduction that onions would be his preferred crop to sell. Poul who is a happy go lucky 40 year old father of 7 says he also ekes out side profits from an old clothes sales business. Paul reveals that his monthly profit returns total up to 270,000 shillings. With this loan, Poul says he is going to purchase 6 bags of onions and old clothes to resell. Poul is affiliated to bring amber court to unite group-Jinja.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of onions and clothes for resale

loans.name: Bring Amber Court To Unite Group 1-Jinja

texts.en: Thirty-eight year old Steven W. is the leader of the bring amber court to unite group 1 - Jinja. Steven is happily married with 5 kids, all of whom are pursuing an education. He has been able to shoulder most of his family’s responsibilities, including the education of his kids, thanks to the income he has been earning from his agro-produce business. For the most part he has been selling onions at the neighbouring amber court market. He began modestly, but with the passage of time the business has made enormous growth strides. He was able to start his current business by selling silver fish. Steven gladly describes himself as tenacious, hard working and strong hearted. His monthly earnings total up to 100,000 shillings. With the proceeds from this loan, he says he is going to buy more onions for resell. He will also use the money to foot the education bills of his kids.

loans.use: To purchase more onions to sell.

loans.name: Hulda Achieng

texts.en:
Hulda W. is 28 years old and is married to Solomon. They have four children: Belinda, 11; Lector, 9; Faith, 6; and Grace, 2.

Hulda runs a retail shop in the Kanyamboni area on the outskirts of Kisumu. She has been running it for the past two years. Hulda is applying for her first loan from Kadet Ltd after being introduced by a friend.  She plans to add more stock of soap, sugar, salt etc. to her shop. 

Her desire is to see her business expand and open up a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: Increase stock in her shop.

loans.name: Katikko Small-Scale Farmers Association-Mityana Group

texts.en: 48-year-old K. George has had his fish-selling business in Katikko landing site-Mityana for 12 years. Previously this married father of 12 operated a retail shop. George, who belongs to the Katikko small-scale farmers group, says success has always been within his grasp given the dedication he puts into his work. George has an amiable disposition and that has endeared him to many of his customers. George also ekes out side profits from agriculture, poultry, pig husbandry and cattle. His weekly profits are about 60,000 shillings. George says that with this loan, he is looking forward to purchasing nets and a boat. He envisages better prospects for his business.

loans.use: The purchase of fish nets and a boat to improve his business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Maria  es divorciada ya hace varios años, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Ella cuenta con un taller en el cual fabrican todo tipo de artículos de plomería los cuales lo vende en un puesto de venta en la feria de la 16 de julio en la ciudad de El Alto. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de material, como ser láminas de aluminio, hierro, etc., en cantidad y así poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ana Maria has been divorced for several years.  She has two school age children.  She lives in her parents’ house in the Pasankeri area in the city of La Paz.

She has a shop where she makes all types of plumbing supplies.  She sells them at a stand in the 16 de Julio fair in the city of El Alto.  That is how she gets her income for her household.

She will use the requested loan to buy large quantities of materials like aluminum sheets and iron, etc. to be able to increase her income.

This is her first loan.  The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies her for a loan.

loans.use: To buy materials like aluminum sheets and iron to make plumbing supplies in her workshop

loans.name: Nkitei Sipaai

texts.en:
Nkitei has been raising animals to sell in Naivasha for one year.  He is 37 years old, married to Loise Nkitei, and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy 10 goats and 15 sheep which he will raise and sell later at a profit, when they mature.

In the future, Nkitei hopes to own rental houses which he considers to be more stable in income.

loans.use: To buy 10 goats and 15 sheep which he will raise and sell when they mature.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.es:
La señora Rose Marie es separada ya hace varios años, tiene tres hijos que van a la universidad, vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
La cliente trabaja realizando todo tipo de trámites legales y de trabajo social, para gente de escasos recursos, cuenta con una oficina en la ciudad de El Alto. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la reparación de la computadora que tiene en su oficina y así realizar mejor su trabajo y  poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Rose Marie has been separated for several years.  She has three children who attend the university.  She lives in her parents’ house in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.

She works doing all types of legal paperwork and social work for people with scarce resources.  She has an office in the city of El Alto.  That is how she gets income for her household.

The requested loan is to repair the computer that she has in her office.  That way she will do her work better and be able to increase her income.

This is her first loan.  The completed socioeconomic evaluation qualifies her for a loan.

loans.use: Cost of repairing the computer in her office

loans.name: Basooka Kwavula Development Association-Mityana Group

texts.en: 63-year-old K. Walusansa worked as a government veterinary officer before he decided to start his current cattle and poultry business 12 years ago. K. is married with 21 children, all of whom have completed school. Aside from the aforementioned business, he also operates a farm in Masaka. His weekly profits equal 500,000 shillings. With this loan, he is going to buy medicines to treat his animals and buy more chicken feed. He is affiliated with the Basooka Kwavula development association-Mityana.

loans.use: The purchase of medicines to treat his animals and also buy more chicken feed

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Eduardo es casado, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar, vive en alquiler durante mucho tiempo, en la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz.
Eduardo trabaja en un grupo de radio taxi, como chofer propietario, realizando rutas entre la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto, su esposa le ayuda preparando comida para ser vendida en un puesto que tiene. Es así como obtienen sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para el arreglo de su movilidad comprando una nueva caja de cambios y así poder continuar trabajando sin problemas y mantener sus ingresos.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Eduardo is married and has three school-age children.  He has lived for a long time in rented property in the Villa Nuevo Potosí district of the city of La Paz.

Eduardo works in a radio taxi firm as an owner-driver.  He works routes between the cities of La Paz and El Alto.  His wife helps by making food to sell in a stall which she has.  This is how they earn their household income.

The loan which he is requesting is to be used to repair his vehicle, buying a new gearbox so that he can continue working without problems and maintain his income.

This is Eduardo's first loan and the socioeconomic analysis which we have conducted qualifies him favorably for a loan.

loans.use: To buy a gearbox for his taxi

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
El señor Israel es  casado  ya hace dos años, tiene un bebe, vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz.
Israel trabaja como carpintero desde joven,. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para adquirir una tienda en la cual se dedicará a la venta de ropa para niños y jóvenes en la ciudad de La Paz y así poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en: Israel has been married for two years, has a baby, and lives in his parents' home in the Villa Nuevo Potosi area of the city of La Paz. Israel has worked as a carpenter since he was young. In this manner he obtains income for his household. The loan requested is to acquire a shop which will be dedicated to selling children's clothing in the city of La Paz and augment his income. This is his first loan and the socioeconomic analysis performed favorably qualified him to access credit.

loans.use: Purchase a space to begin a business selling clothing for children and young adults.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet tiene 35 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. Yanet es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella tiene un puesto de venta en el paradero final de los buses “Wimpillay”, donde vende desayunos y otros platos de comida. Hace varios años que empezó este negocio y con un poco de capital pero ahora, ella tiene un pequeño kiosco y la pueden encontrar en su puesto de venta que está equipado con una cocina, platos, mesas, sillas y muchas cosas más, ella sale a vender todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la mañana o hasta que se acabe la comida. 

Yanet desprende una imagen de una mujer trabajadora y responsable. Un flujo de clientes vistan el kiosco y el negocio se anima bastante durante la hora en que llegan los choferes y los ayudantes. Ella vende sus platos comida a un precio cómodo y accesible para los clientes y sobre todo de buena calidad, esto la distingue de la competencia. Con su próximo préstamo, Yanet espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Por el momento, desea incrementar el capital del negocio y va comprar más insumos como por ejemplo, carne, papa, verduras, arroz y muchos productos más. 

Yanet pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yanet is 35 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Cusco is a charming city which dates back to Inca times and was built on the site of the ancient Inca city.  Yanet is married and has two children.  She has a food stall at the last stop on the “Wimpillay” bus route where she sells breakfasts and other meals.  She started this business several years ago with a little capital but now she has a small kiosk and she is to be found at her stall which is equipped with a stove, plates, tables, seats and many other things.  She goes out to sell her food every day from 7 in the morning until 11 in the morning or until she runs out of food to sell.

Yanet is the very image of a hard-working and responsible woman.  A tide of customers visit her kiosk and her business gets very lively when the bus drivers and their assistants arrive.  She sells her meals at a price which is suitable and reasonable for her customers and, above all, she sells good quality food.  This is what sets her apart from the competition.  Yanet hopes to receive a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles,  She would like to increase her business capital and buy more supplies such as meat, potatoes, vegetables, rice and many other products.

Yanet belongs to the “Mosoc Killa” community bank and is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given.  She pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy more supplies such as meat, potatoes, vegetables, rice and many other products

loans.name: Santos Graciano

texts.es:
Don Santos de 59 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel donde vive con su familia su esposa y dos hijos que ya no dependen  de él; este oficio fue inculcado por su padres desde joven, ya que también se dedicaron al cultivo de la tierra, don Santos trabaja solo, sin horario fijo.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de los materiales agrícolas, y alimentación para el ganado, esta ayuda le dará la oportunidad de cultivar y dar un buen cuido a la siembra pues tendrá los materiales como abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento para plagas, al igual con su ganado podrá tenerles alimentación para un buen tiempo.
Uno de sus propósitos es administrar bien el préstamo, desarrollar su buena siembra y que a través de su negocio pueda ayudar a otras personas.
texts.en:
Santos is 59 years old.  He is a farmer, and he raises cattle.  He lives in the El Transito department of San Miguel.  He lives with his wife and two children.  His children are no longer dependent upon him.

His parents taught him this profession when he was young because they also cultivated the land.  Santos works alone without a fixed schedule.

He is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies and feed for his livestock.  This help will give him the opportunity to cultivate and take good care of his crops.  He will have materials like organic and chemical fertilizers and treatments for pest infestations.  He will also be able to have feed for his livestock for a good time.

His goals are to manage the loan well, to develop good crops, and to be able to help other people through his business.

loans.use: To buy organic and chemical fertilizers for his crops and feed for his livestock

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias tiene 24 años, es soltero y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. Elias trabaja en un taller mecánica y le pueden encontrar en su trabajo todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. 

Elias desprende una imagen de un hombre trabajador y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Elias espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Por el momento, desea incrementar el capital del negocio y va comprar repuestos de carro como por ejemplo pistones, llantas y muchas cosas más. 

Elias pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Elias is 24 years old, single, and lives in the city of Cusco, Perú, a charming city that dates back to Incan times and which was built on the base of the ancient Incan city. Elias works in a mechanic's shop and may be found at work every day from 8 in the morning until 8 at night. 

Elias gives off an image of a hard-working and responsible man. With his next loan Elias hopes to receive 1500 nuevos soles. For the time being he wishes to increase his business capital and will purchase spare parts such as, for example, pistons, tires and many other items. 

Elias belongs to the communal bank "Mosoc Killa" and is appreciative of the opportunity offered through this means. Likewise he commits himself to making the payments according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy spare automobile parts, for example, pistons, tires and many other things

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Milagro, se dedica  a la venta de tostadas de plátano, enchiladas y refrescos, vive con su familia, tiene 44 años es madre soltera tiene un hijo, en su familia todos trabajan, residen en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, para iniciar con este negocio contaba con el apoyo de su madre y una amiga le enseño a preparar esta venta, no tiene horario de trabajo y desea adquirir mercadería para realizar la venta.
Para realizar esta inversión ella solicita un préstamo que le ayude para poder preparar mejor su trabajo y obtener mayores ganancias, ella comprara plátano verde, preparativos para los refrescos  entre otros que le son necesarios.  
Su fin es aportar al negocio el dinero para crecer y ofrecer más a los clientes, estar pendiente de las necesidades de su hijo y velar por que no le falte la alimentación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Milagro sells fried plantains, enchiladas, and sodas. She lives with her family, is 44 years old, and is a single mother with one child. Everyone in her family works. They live in the Transito department of San Miguel. To begin her business she counted on her mother’s help as well as a friend who helped her prepare it. As of now she does not have a work schedule and wishes to obtain merchandise to be able to sell. To be able to invest she needs a loan that will help her better prepare her work and make the highest possible profit. She will buy green bananas, things to serve sodas with, as well as other necessary things.
Her goal is to obtain the money for her business so it can grow and she can offer more to her clients, be more available for her son and make sure he always has something to eat.

loans.use: Green plantains and things to serve sodas with.

loans.name: Clodilte

texts.es:
Clotilde tiene 58 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. Clotilde es divorciada, tiene tres hijos y es profesora.

 Ya son varios años que se dedica a enseñar.  Clotilde desprende una imagen de una mujer trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Clotilde espera recibir S/. 2500 nuevos soles. Por el momento, desea construir su casa y va comprar materiales como por ejemplo, cemento, clavos, puertas, ventanas y muchas cosas más. 

Clotilde pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Clotilde is 58 years old and lives in the town of Cusco, Peru. Cusco is a captivating town dating back to Incan times, built on top of the ancient Incan town. Clotilde is divorced, she is a professor and has three children.

She has been teaching for many years already. Clotilde is the very image of a hard-working and responsible woman. With her next loan of 2500 PEN, Clotilde would like to have her house built, and she will buy materials such as cement, nails, doors, windows and many other items.

Clotilde is a member of the Mosoc Killa Communal Bank, and she is thankful for the opportunity she is being given through this loan; at the same time she commits to complying with her repayments as scheduled.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, nails, doors and windows.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 25 años, es soltera y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. Verónica tiene un pequeño consultorio dental. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

 Verónica desprende una imagen de una joven trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Verónica espera recibir S/. 800 nuevos soles. Por el momento, desea incrementar el capital de negocio y desea comprar material dental y otras cosas más. 

Verónica pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Verónica is 25 years old, she is single and lives in the town of Cusco, Peru. Cusco is a captivating town dating back to Incan times, built on top of the ancient Incan town. Verónica runs a small dental office. She has been engaging in this activity for many years, and it works very well for her thanks to her determination in doing her job.

Véronica is the very image of a hard-working and responsible young woman. With her next loan of 800 PEN, Véronica would like to increase her working capital and to buy dental materials and other items.

Verónica is a member of the Mosoc Killa Communal Bank, and she is thankful for the opportunity she is being given through this loan; at the same time she commits to complying with her repayments as scheduled.

loans.use: To increase her working capital and to buy dental materials and other items.

loans.name: Margo

texts.es:
Doña Margo, es una señora muy trabajadora a sus 74 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa y pollo, vive con su madre en el municipio El Transito departamento de San Miguel, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 26 años, el negocio lo inicio hace varios años con la ayuda de su madre, no tiene horario para realizarlo y actualmente está en busca de ayuda para invertir en el negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa y pollo para salir a ofrecer a los clientes, esto le ayudara a mantener siempre el negocio y a contar con varias prendas de vestir para la venta, al igual que podrá ofrecer pollo a sus vecinos y clientes.
Para ella el sueño principal es vivir en armonía con su familia, aportar dinero para cubrir los gastos del hogar y seguir progresando con el negocio.
texts.en:
Margo, 74, is a very hard working woman.  She sells clothes and chicken.  She lives with her mother in El Transito, San Miguel department.  She is a single mother of a 26-year-old son.  She started the business with her mother’s help many years ago.  She does not have a fixed work schedule and is currently looking for help to invest in the business.

She is asking for a loan to buy clothes and chicken to go out to sell to customers.  This will help her stay in business and have new items of clothing to sell as well as to be able to offer chicken to her neighbors and customers.

For her, the main dream is to live in harmony with her family, to provide money to covert household expenses, and to continue progressing with the business.

loans.use: To buy clothes and chicken.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 39 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. Julia tiene un pequeño negocio de elaboración y venta de tortas de forma independiente. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

 Julia desprende una imagen de una madre trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Julia espera recibir S/. 800 nuevos soles. Por el momento, desea incrementar el capital de negocio y desea comprar ingredientes como por ejemplo harina, azúcar, mantequilla y otras cosas más. 

Julia pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Julia is 39 years old and lives in the town of Cusco, Peru. Cusco is a captivating town dating back to Incan times, built on top of the ancient Incan town. Julia independently runs a small shop where she prepares and sells cakes. She has been engaging in this activity for many years, and it works very well for her thanks to her determination in doing her job.

Julia is the very image of a hard-working and responsible mother. With her next loan of 800 PEN, Julia would like to increase her working capital and to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, butter and other items. 

Julia is a member of the Mosoc Killa Communal Bank, and she is thankful for the opportunity she is being given through this loan; at the same time she commits to complying with her repayments as scheduled.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, sugar and butter.

loans.name: Marco Alexander

texts.es:
Marco Alexander tiene 37 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Marco Alexander tiene un pequeño negocio de que consiste en alquilar equipos de sonidos para ceremonias. Hace varios años que empezó este negocio y con un poco de capital pero ahora, él tiene un pequeño almacén que está equipado con parlantes, micrófonos, disco de música, amplificadores de sonido, mezcladores de música  y muchas cosas más, él alquila sus artefactos a personas conocidas, amigos, etc. 

Marco Alexander desprende una imagen de un joven trabajador y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Marcos que espera recibir S/. 800 nuevos soles. Por el momento, desea incrementar el capital del negocio y va comprar parlantes y otras cosas. 

Marco Alexander pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marco Alexander is 37 years old and lives in the town of Cusco, Peru. Cusco is a captivating town dating back to Incan times, built on top of the ancient Incan town.

Marco Alexander runs a small activity consisting in renting out sound systems for celebrations. He started this activity a few years ago with a small amount of capital, but he now owns a small storehouse furnished with loudspeakers, microphones, music discs, sound amplifiers, music mixers and many other items. He rents his equipment to people he knows, to friends and so on.

Marco Alexander is the very image of a hard-working and responsible young man. With his next loan of 800 PEN, Marco would like to increase his working capital and to buy other loudspeakers and other items.

Marco Alexander is a member of the Mosoc Killa Communal Bank, and he is thankful for the opportunity he is being given through this loan; at the same time he commits to complying with his repayments as scheduled.

loans.use: To increase his working capital and to buy loudspeakers and other items.

loans.name: Wilda

texts.es:
Wilda pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Wilda tiene 32 años, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con las del pequeño negocio de venta de comida. Hace varios años que empezó este negocio y con un poco de capital pero ahora, ella tiene un restaurante que está equipado con las necesidades básicas como por ejemplo una cocina, mesas, sillas y muchas cosas más. Wilda desprende una imagen de una madre trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Wilda que espera recibir S/. 500 nuevos soles. Por el momento, desea pagar unas  cuotas del terreno que compro a crédito. 
 
Wilda se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Wilda belongs to the communal bank "Mosoc Killa," which is part of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  She lives in the same city.  Cusco is an enchanting city that dates back to the time of the Incas which was built upon the base of an ancient Incan city.

Wilda is 32 years old, married, and has 2 children from this marriage.  She alternates her activities between caring for her home and for her small business selling food.  She started this business a number of years ago with a small amount of capital, but now she has a restaurant that is set up with all of the basic requirements including a kitchen, tables, chairs, and many other things.  Wilda comes across as a hardworking and responsible mother.  With her next loan, Wilda hopes to receive 500 Peruvian soles.  At this moment, she wants to make some payments on some land that she bought on credit.

Wilda is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and is therefore committed to making her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: she wants to make some payments on land that she bought on credit.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es:
Don José de 38 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, tiene una tienda donde ofrece a sus clientes artículos de primera necesidad (azúcar, jabon, frijol, cafe, papel higienico,pasta dental, etc), el vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas  de 12 y 10 años de edad; El negocio lo inicio junto a su esposa ya que ella tiene experiencia  en el comercio por que se ha dedicado a ello, el horario de atención es de 6:00am a 6:00pm, la ventaja para ellos es que tienen un buen número de clientes que atender.
Por el momento ellos necesitan dinero para  invertir en mercadería pero no cuentan con la suficiente solvencia económica por lo que solicitan un préstamo para Salir de esta nueva etapa en su negocio, lo que pretenden es surtir de mercadería que es más demandada y así satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes, esta ayuda le dará crecimiento y estabilidad tanto al negocio como a la familia ya que contaran con mayores ingresos, su único riesgo es la delincuencia y que las ventas bajen su nivel normal.
La proyección de José con respecto al negocio es tener estabilidad en su inventario de mercadería, seguir creciendo su atención a los clientes y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 38 years old and lives in the Usulután department where he has a small store that offers basic necessities to his customers (such as sugar, soap, beans, coffee, toilet paper, toothpaste, etc.)  He lives with his wife and their 2 children who are 12 and 10 years old.  He started this business with his wife, since she had experience in retail trade because she had worked in that area.  The store is open from 6am until 6pm, and the advantage for them is that they have a good number of customers to serve.

At this moment, they need money to invest in merchandise, but they don't have sufficient economic resources, so they are requesting a loan to embark on this new stage in their business.  Their aim is to stock their business with merchandise that is in demand, so that they can better satisfy the needs of their customers.  This assistance will give them growth and stability in their business as well as for their family, since they will be able to count on a higher income.  The only risks are crime and that sales might dip below their usual levels.

Jose's plan regarding the business is to have stability in his inventory of merchandise, to continue to improve his service to his customers and to improve the conditions of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: basic household consumer goods.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Ana María tiene 36 años, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con las del pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos. Hace varios años que empezó este negocio y con un poco de capital pero ahora, ella tiene una cantidad considerable de clientes que adquieren sus productos de belleza y lo que más sus piden clientes son por ejemplo perfumes, aretes y pulseras. Ana María desprende una imagen de una madre trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Ana María que espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va comprar más productos de belleza. 

Ana María se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ana María belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Mosoc Killa” Communal Bank in Cusco, where she also lives. Cusco is a charming city that dates back to Incan times.
Ana María is 36 years old and married with two children. She divides her time between the home and her little cosmetics business. She started this business several years ago with a little capital but now she has a considerable number of clients who buy her beauty products. Her clients mostly ask for perfume, earrings and bracelets. Ana María reflects the image of a hard-working and responsible mother. Ana María hopes to receive 1500 PEN for her next loan. For now, she would like to expand her business and will buy more cosmetics.
Ana María is grateful for this opportunity and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Yelybeth

texts.es:
Yelybeth pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Yelybeth tiene 23 años, es soltera y estudia la carrera profesional de Contabilidad, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de fotocopias, impresiones y tipeos en computadora en frente de la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ana María desprende una imagen de una joven trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Yelybeth que espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va comprar más productos de belleza. 

Yelybeth se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yelybeth belongs to Asociación Arariwa's “Mosoc Killa” community bank in the city of Cusco.  She lives in the same city.  Cusco is a charming city which dates back to Inca times.  It was built on the site of the ancient Inca city.

Yelybeth is 23 years old.  She is single and is studying accountancy.  She has a small photocopying, printing and computer typing business opposite the Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco.  She has been in this business for several years and it is doing really well thanks to the great effort which she puts into her work.  Ana María is the very image of a hard-working and responsible young woman.  With her loan for 1,500 nuevos soles Yelybeth would like to increase her business and buy more products.

Yelybeth is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To increase her business and buy more products

loans.name: Faustina Aba Beduwa

texts.en: Faustina Aba Beduwa A. sells gari (cassava flakes) bagged in small quantities in Abura. She has no formal education. She is married and her husband works with a printing press. She helps look after the general well-being of the home. She is asking for a loan to expand her gari business. She hopes to buy land with her profit.

loans.use: To expand her gari business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Lilian tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos, ella tiene un pequeño negocio familiar junto con su esposo que consiste en la fabricación de muebles de madera. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Lilian desprende una imagen de una madre trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Lilian que espera recibir S/. 800 nuevos soles. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va comprar más materiales como por ejemplo madera, clavos, goma de carpintero, etc.  

Lilian se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lilian belongs to Asociación Arariwa's “Mosoc Killa” community bank in the city of Cusco.  She lives in the same city.  Cusco is a charming city which dates back to Inca times.  It was built on the site of the ancient Inca city.

Lilian is 39 years old.  She is married with two children and has a small family business together with her husband where they make wooden furniture.  She has been in this business for several years and it is doing very well thanks to the great effort which she puts into her work.  Lilian is the very image of a hard-working and responsible mother.  With her loan for 800 nuevos soles, Lilian would like to increase her business and buy more materials such as wood, nails, carpenter's glue, etc.

Lilian is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To increase her business and buy more materials such as wood, nails, carpenter's glue, etc.

loans.name: Elsy Maribel

texts.es:
Elsy, es una señora de 43 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, donde vive con su hijo de 18 años de edad este estudia actualmente, su negocio es la preparación y venta de tortillas y lo inicio por la motivación que le dio una amiga que también es tortillera, trabaja con dos empleadas, su horario de venta es de 9:00am a 2:00pm; ella quiere comprar leña, maíz, gas y una plancha para hacer tortillas, para esto solicita un préstamo que le ayude a realizar la inversión.
Su meta es fortalecer el negocio, aumentar la cantidad de tortillas que vende, para mantener este negocio por un buen tiempo y generando los ingresos necesarios para lograr la superación de su hijo, ya que su sueño es tener a su hijo con una carrera universitaria terminada.
texts.en:
Elsy is 43 years old and lives with her 18-year-old son, who currently attends school, in the El Transito department of San Miguel. She runs a business making and selling tortillas. Her friend, who also makes tortillas, motivated her to start this business. She works with two employees and is open from 9:00am until 2:00pm.
She would like to buy wood, corn, gas and a tortilla grill. She is requesting a loan to help her make this investment.
Her goal is to strengthen her business and to increase the quantity of tortillas she sells in order to make her business sustainable and to generate enough revenue to improve the life of her son. Her dream is to see her son complete a university degree.

loans.use: Purchase wood, corn gas and a tortilla grill

loans.name: Habiba Efua

texts.en: Habiba Efua I. lives with her husband and four children. She has been through junior high school. Habiba sells soft drinks in Asenadze near Abura. Her husband is a mason. She assists her husband with the upkeep of their home. She will use this loan to purchase new types of soft drinks to meet the demands of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Habiba plans to build a shop.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Evangelina tiene 50  años, es madre y padre para su hijo, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, ella distribuye a diferentes mercados y también vende a choferes, cobradores de diferentes agencias de transportes, ella vende ropa como por ejemplo casacas, pantalones, buzos, muchas ropas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Evangelina desprende una imagen de una madre trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Evangelina que espera recibir S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va comprar más ropa como por ejemplo pantalones, camisas, casacas, etc.  

Evangelina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Evangelina belongs to Asociación Arariwa's “Mosoc Killa” community bank in the city of Cusco.  She lives in the same city.  Cusco is a charming city which dates back to Inca times.  It was built on the site of the ancient Inca city.

Evangelina is 50 years old.  She is both mother and father to her son.  She has a small business selling clothes.  She distributes clothes to different markets and also sells to drivers and conductors from different transport agencies.  She sells clothes such as jackets, pants, sweatshirts, and many others.  She has been in this business for several years and her business is doing very well thanks to the great effort which she puts into her work.  Evangelina is the very image of a hard-working and responsible woman.  With her loan for 1,500 nuevos soles, Evangelina would like to increase her business and buy more clothes such as pants, shirts, jackets, etc.

Evangelina is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To increase her business and buy more clothes such as pants, shirts, jackets, etc.

loans.name: Faustina Esi Yakomago

texts.en: Faustina Esi Yakomago M. is married and has one child. She has received senior high school education. She sells charcoal in Abura. Her husband is a spare parts seller. Faustina assists her husband with the feeding, clothing and education of their children. She wishes to increase her sale of charcoal with this loan. She plans to reinvest her additional income into her business.

loans.use: To increase her sale of charcoal

loans.name: Cecilia Ama Amoniwah

texts.en: Cecilia Ama Amoniwah A. is married and has a child. She has been through junior high school. She cooks banku (a local dish made from corn dough) in the evenings for sale in Abura. The photograph was taken in the morning and shows a sample of the corn dough she will be using to prepare banku in the evening. Her husband is a farmer. Cecilia assists her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. She is asking for a loan to expand her business. Cecilia plans to save the new profits from her expanded business for her child’s education.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Agnes Esi Essoun

texts.en: Agnes Esi Essoun K. sells gari (gari is made from cassava) in Abura. Agnes has not received any formal education. She is married and has six dependants. Her husband is a carpenter. She assists her husband taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of gari for sale. She hopes to reinvest her additional income.

loans.use: To buy more bags of gari for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria pertenece al banco comunal “Juntas y Unidas” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Victoria tiene 58 años, es madre y padre para sus cuatro hijos, ella tiene unos pequeños negocios de venta de cosméticos y tejidos, ella distribuye sus productos acredito a sus amigas, vecinos y familiares, quienes les pagan a fines de cada mes. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Victoria desprende una imagen de una madre trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Victoria que espera recibir $ 200 USD. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va comprar cosméticos y lana para sus tejidos. 

Victoria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Victoria is a member of the communal bank called "Juntas y Unidas", (Together and United), an association in the city of Cusco where she lives.  Cusco is a charming city from the time of the ancient Incas.  Victoria is 58 years old and a single parent to her 4 children.  Victoria has a few small businesses selling cosmetics and fabrics.  She sells her products to her friends, neighbors and acquaintances, who all pay her at the end of each month.   It's been several years now since she's run her businesses and things have been going well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.   Victoria is a hardworking and responsible mother.  With the new loan, she plans to grow her businesses by purchasing more cosmetics and wool for her fabrics.   Victoria appreciates the opportunity the communal bank provides to her, and she commits to comply with her payment schedule.

loans.use: Victoria will use the money to purchase cosmetics and wool to help grow her businesses.

loans.name: Efia

texts.en: Efia K. is a married woman taking care of four children. She has no formal education. Efia sells gari (milled cassava) and plantain in Asenadze near Abura. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband in providing the needs of the home. Efia will use her loan to purchase other varieties of foodstuffs for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efia plans to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase other varieties of foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor es un joven de 25 años de edad, muy emprendedor ayuda a su madre con los gastos del hogar, se dedica a la venta de medicina de forma ambulante, vive con sus padres es soltero y no tiene hijos, todos trabajan en la familia para cubrir las necesidades que a diario enfrentan, ellos residen en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel.
El tiene el negocio de medicinas que lo aprendió en su primer trabajo después él quiso tener su propio negocio y fue así como dio inicio a su propia venta;  él ya cuenta con clientela y la visita seguido ofreciéndole medicamentos, pero por el momento Víctor necesita invertir en el negocio para ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos  y diversificar la venta, esta inversión la hará solamente a través de un préstamo, permitiéndole crecer y estabilizarse.
Él quiere convertirse en un vendedor mayoritario, tener un negocio prospero, y darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Victor is 25 years old.  An enterprising young man who helps his mother with the household expenses, Victor works selling various natural medicines and health products.   He lives with his parents and is still single and without children.   They live in an area called San Rafael Oriente in San Migeul, and the entire family works to cover their daily expenses.  Victor learned about his current work in his first job, after which he decided to start his own business.   He now counts on regular customers.  He would like to invest in his business and be able to offer a greater number of products to his customers.   He can only make this investment with a loan, which would permit him to to grow and establish his business even more.   Victor has become a good salesman, he has a prosperous business and he's been able to help contribute to his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more of the natural medicines he sells in his business.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Esther Efua Ewusiwa

texts.en: Esther Efua Ewusiwa E. sells ladies shoes and sandals in Abura. Esther is married to a farmer and has three children. She has been in this business for two years. She assists her husband with the general upkeep of the home. This loan will be used to buy more shoes and items which are very often requested by her customers. She hopes to reinvest her additional income.

loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Sofia;   ella tiene 61 años D. edad, es separada y tiene 3 hijos, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta D. alimentos, la socia trabaja vendiendo comidas tradicionales,  en su restaurante, pero en esta ocasión la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la construcción D. un cerco para cubrir su terreno,  ella comprara materiales para cercar su terreno y D. esta forma cubrir los muros con tejas para que las lluvias que vienen no lo derrumben. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales D. construcción para cercar su terreno.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Sofia is a member of the communal bank located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco.   Sofia is 61 years old and takes care of 3 children.  She is separated from her husband.   She alternates her work taking care of her family with a restaurant business where she sells traditional meals.    On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to purchase some construction materials.   She needs to fence in the retaining walls near her home so that the coming rains don't destroy them.  Sofia appreciates and values these loans, and she commits to comply with the payments on schedule.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to fence in the retaining walls near her home so that the coming rains don't destroy them.

loans.name: Paola Zuleyma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Paola;   ella tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con sus estudios de enfermería, la socia actualmente se encuentra haciendo un curso de especialización en enfermería “Salud Ocupacional”; ella acabo la carrera de enfermería y está haciendo varios cursos para complementar sus estudios realizados. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertirlo en su curso de especialización. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en sus estudios.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This member belongs to the community bank "ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN."  The community bank is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, and Cusco department.  The member is Ms. Paola.  She is 25 years old and single.  This member alternates between her home activities and her nursing studies.  This member now is taking a specialized nursing course called "Occupational Health".  She finished her degree in nursing and is now taking various courses to compliment her completed studies.  This member needs the loan to invest in her specialization course.  This member asks for a loan to invest in her studies.  This member is grateful for and values the loan given through these means and in the same way she promises to fulfill the payments in the established time frame

loans.use: This member asks for a loan to invest in her studies.

loans.name: Mary Aba Nurumah

texts.en: Mary Aba Nurumah O. is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. She has been through senior high school. Mary cooks rice and yams at Asenadze near Abura for sale. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. The loan will be added to her initial capital to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to build a shop.

loans.use: add to her initial capital to expand her business

loans.name: Vilma Amparo

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Vilma;   ella tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista la socia compra ropa al por mayor en medianas cantidades y las distribuye de forma independiente; la socia vende ropa y juguetes según las temporadas, ahora que llega las fiestas navideñas ella cambiara y traerá más juguetes para la venta que de costumbre, ella busca las novedades y las trae a sus clientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería (ropa y juguetes).

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN” communal bank. The communal bank is located in the district of Huanchac, province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Vilma; she is 42 years old, married and has 3 children. The member varies her activities of her home with her retail business. The member buys clothing wholesale in medium quantity and distributes them independently. Mrs. Vilma sells clothing and toys according to the season, and now that the Christmas season is coming she will change and buy more toys than she has before and look for the newest toys to sell to her customers. The member needs the loan to buy merchandize (clothing and toys).

The member is very grateful and values the loan given to her through this medium and she is also committed to meet her payment quotas in the time agreed.

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy merchandize (clothing and toys).

loans.name: Mary Obaa Yaa

texts.en: Mary Obaa Yaa A. cooks several varieties of food for sale at Abura. Mary has received junior high education. She is married and has seven dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to cook to meet the request of her customers. She hopes to reinvest her additional income.

loans.use: buy more foodstuffs to cook

loans.name: Iye

texts.en:
This is thirty-five-year-old Iye F.. Born in Karena village, this wife and mother of three children is a small-scale businesswoman in Makeni city. Her husband is a retired and her children are all attending primary and secondary schools. 

Iye wants a loan of SLL 4,000,000 to invest in her business. She sells locally dyed cloth (gara lappers). She has been in this business for seven years now. However, her business has been growing at a very slow pace due to the lack of sufficient capital. Thus she has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan in order to expand her business. With this loan, she will buy “brillians” (white cloth), inks, caustic soda, powder and pay artists to make special designs on the white cloth.

loans.use: Buy white cloth, inks, caustic soda, powder and pay artists to make special designs on the white cloth

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Delia;   ella tiene 40 años de edad, es casada, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración y atención de sus tienda de abarrotes, la misma que está al cuidado de toda la familia, la socia suele apoyar económicamente a su madre que tiene un pequeño restaurante y ella le otorga el capital para trabajar en el restaurante, una vez recuperado el capital la mamá de la socia le retorna el préstamo y ella compra la mercadería para la tienda de abarrotes. La socia en esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para entregarle a su mamá y que esta pueda utilizar como capital de trabajo en su restaurante, comprara carne, aceite al por mayor entre otros productos y parte de este dinero le servirá a la socia para la compra de su mercadería (arroz, azúcar y otros). La socia solicita el préstamo para apoyar a su madre y comprar con parte de este mercadería.

La  socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN” communal bank. The communal bank is located in the district of Huanchac, province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Delia; she is 40 years old and married. The member alternates her activities in the home with the management and duties of her small grocery store, as well as taking care of all of her family. Mrs. Delia is supporting her mother financially as her mother has a small restaurant and Mrs. Delia gives her the capital to work in it, once she gets back the loan from her mother she will buy merchandize for her small store. The member in this loan cycle will give her mother the money as work capital for her restaurant, to buy meat and oil wholesale among other products and another part of the money will be used by Mrs. Delia to buy merchandize (rice, sugar, etc.) The member needs the loan to help her mother and to buy some merchandize for herself.

The member is very grateful and values the loan given to her through this medium, and she is also committed to meet her payment quotas in the time agreed.

loans.use: The member needs the loan to help her mother and to buy some merchandize for herself.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria pertenece al banco comunal “Juntas y Unidas” D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base D. la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Gregoria tiene 63 años, es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene cuatro hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con su pequeño negocio D. venta D. comestibles, ella tiene un tienda D. abarrotes en su domicilio donD. venD. sus productos a sus vecinos. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Gregoria desprenD. una imagen D. una madre trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Gregoria que espera recibir $ 500 USD. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va comprar comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, etc.
 
Gregoria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gregoria belongs to the “Juntas y Unidas” (Together and United) communal bank of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco; she lives in the same city. Cusco is a beautiful city that goes back to Incan times; it was built in the base of the ancient Inca city.

Gregoria is 63 years old, married and through her marriage she has four children. She interchanges her activities in the home with her small business, selling foodstuffs. Gregoria has a small grocery store in her home where she sells her products to her neighbors. It has been a few years that she has been involved in this business and she does very well thanks to the hard work that she puts into her business. Gregoria is a picture of a hardworking and responsible mother. With the next loan that Gregoria hopes to receive of $500 USD, she hopes to expand her business and will buy foodstuffs like rice, sugar, spaghettis, milk, etc.

Gregoria is very grateful for the opportunity given to her through this medium and is committed to meet with the payments agreed according to schedule.

loans.use: She hopes to expand her business and will buy foodstuffs like rice, sugar, spaghettis, milk, etc.

loans.name: Ruth Pascuala

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Ruth;   ella tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención y administración de sus tienda de abarrotes, ella tiene una tienda en su casa en la planta baja que da  a la calle principal, la socia vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y los alterna también con materiales de escritorio, y un poco de adornos y regalos, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar mayor mercadería como fideos, leche, azúcar, arroz aceite todo al por mayor. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN” communal bank. The communal bank is located in the district of Huanchac, province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Ruth; she is 52 years old, married and has 3 children. The member alternates her activities in the home as well as the duties and management of her small grocery store. Mrs. Ruth has a store in the first floor of her home that leads to the street; she sells all types of basic household goods in addition to office products, decorations and gifts. Mrs. Ruth needs the loan to buy a greater amount of merchandize like spaghettis, milk, sugar, rice and oil, all wholesale. The member needs the loan to buy merchandize.

The member is very grateful and values the loan given to her through this medium she is also committed to meet her payment quotas in the time agreed.

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy merchandize.

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is forty-six-year-old Foday F.. Born in Binkolo village, this husband and father of five children is a small-scale businessman in Makeni city. His wife is a businesswoman, too, and his children are all attending primary and secondary schools. 

Foday wants a loan of SLL 3,000,000 to invest in his business. He sells used clothes. He has been in this business for twenty-five years now. However, his business has been growing at a very slow pace due to the lack of sufficient capital. Thus he has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan in order to expand his business. With this loan, he will buy bales of used clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: Buy bales of used clothes for resale

loans.name: Juan Arsecio

texts.es:
Juan Arsecio Y. T. tiene 45 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Juan  pertenece a la Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería como vacas lecheras y chanchos, esta ventanilla tiene 20 miembros.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y a la ganadería cría vacas lecheras, las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y animales para engordar y después vender. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es ponerse comprar casa, carro y terrenos para tener sus animales.
Le gusta caminar con la familia y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Juan Arsecio Y. T. is 45 years old, married and lives with this wife and 3 children, they live in the area of Guaranda in the Province of Bolívar.

Juan belongs to the Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba located half an hour from Guaranda. It is a group that dedicates themselves to agriculture and stock breeding like dairy cows and pigs, the group has 20 members.

Juan grows corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes and breeds dairy cows. He buys in Guaranda and sells to a wholesale market in the same city.

He needs the loan to buy merchandize to grow corn, wheat, beans and potatoes and animals to fatten up and later sell. The loan will help him financially to meet his families’ needs. His dream is to be able to buy a home, car and fields to have his animals.

Juan likes to walk with his family and to listen to music.

loans.use: To buy merchandize to grow corn, wheat, beans and potatoes and animals to fatten up and later sell.

loans.name: Darcy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr.  Darcy;   el socio tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, el socio es nuevo integrante del grupo comunal, el socio trabaja vendiendo productos de salud llamados herbalife, el socio es independiente y visita toda la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos, el socio nos comenta que se hizo parte de este grupo por invitación de sus amigas y que desea tener un capital de trabajo para poder pedir mayor número en productos y ofrecer a sus clientes. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de salud y continuar su crecimiento en cuanto llegar a ser uno de los lideres de ventas.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN” communal bank. The communal bank is located in the district of Huanchac, province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Darcy, he is 24 years old, single and is a new member of the communal bank. The member works selling health products called herbalife; he is independent and visits the whole city offering his products. Mr. Darcy tells us that he became a part of this group by an invitation from his friends and that he wants to have work capital to have a greater quantity of products to offer to his customers. The member needs the loan to buy health products and to keep growing and become one of the top salesmen.

The member is very grateful and values the loan given to him through this medium he is also committed to meet his payment quotas in the time agreed.

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy health products.

loans.name: Tania Frineti

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Tania;   ella tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera,  y tiene 1 hijo, La socia alterna sus actividades D. hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia compra y vende ropa de forma independiente ella tiene sus clientes a los cuales frecuentemente les trae novedades como chompas, polos, pantalones; entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropas de temporada y venderlas.

La  socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y D. mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN” communal bank. The communal bank is located in the district of Huanchac, province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Tania; she is 34 years old, is single and has a child. The member varies her activities in her home with those of a retailer. Mrs. Tania buys and sells clothing independently and has regular customers that she frequently shows the latest fashions like sweaters, polos, pants among other items. The member needs the loan to buy seasonal clothing to sell.

The member is very grateful and values the loan given to her through this medium, and she is also committed to meet her payment quotas in the time agreed.

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy seasonal clothing to sell.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
