loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
El señor Elías tiene 48 años de edad el vive en Viloma una comunidad de la provincia de Sipe Sipe a unos veinte kilómetros de la ciudad de Cochabamba él se encuentra casado con la señora Hilda con la cual tiene seis hijos, dos de ellos ya son independientes  Elías trabaja como albañil en la zona en la que vive y también recibe contratos de otras provincias del departamento de la ciudad.
Elías  vivía en la ciudad de Santa Cruz  hace como cinco años atrás el tuvo que venir a Cochabamba porque tuvo un problema con la cuñada ya que por culpa de esa persona  Elías perdió su casa y todas sus pertenencias en un remate por el banco, el se volvió a levantar y junto a su familia tomaron un nuevo rumbo en su camino empezaron de cero, ahora él y su esposa tienen una casita y terrenos en los cuales van sembrando maíz y la producción sacan cada seis meses esa es una de las maneras en la que obtienen sus ingresos y de la misma manera el trabaja como albañil realizando trabajos de construcción y su esposa trabaja en un vivero cuidando las flores que se producen en la zona en distintas temporadas del año, además cuenta con sembradíos de papa y maíz, con todas esta actividades logra sustentar a su familia. 

 El préstamo que solicita Elías es para comprar una acción de agua para poder  realizar sus regadíos todo el año para sus cultivos ya sea de papa o maíz y de esa manera podrán tener más ingresos y poder ayudar a sus hijos a terminar el colegio.

Elías sueña con un futuro mejor para sus hijos ya que el no pudo terminar el colegio ni hacer una carrera, pero él quiere que sus hijos si puedan realizar una carrera y poder ayudar a las personas de la zona.
texts.en:
Sr. Elias is 48 years old and lives in Viloma, a community in Sipe Sipe Province that is located 20 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. He is married to Sra. Hilda and they have six children, of whom two are already independent. Elias works as a mason in the area where he lives, but he also receives contracts from other provinces within the department as well as from the city.

Elias lived in the city of Santa Cruz five years ago before returning to Cochabamba because of a problem with his sister-in-law. Through the fault of this person, Elias lost his house and all of his belongings were auctioned off by the bank. He and his family picked themselves up and moved in a new direction so that they could start over. Elias and his wife now have a cottage and land for growing corn, which is harvested every six months and provides an additional source of income. While Elias is working as a mason on different construction jobs, his wife works at a plant nursery caring for flowers that are grown in the area for specific times of the year. They also grow potatoes and corn to help support their family.

The loan Elias is requesting will be used to purchase water so that he can irrigate his crops of potatoes and corn throughout the year. This will help him earn more income so that his children can finish their high school studies.

In the future, Elias dreams of seeing his children finish high school since he was not able to earn a degree. He wants them to pursue a degree so that they can help people in the area.

loans.use: Acquire water to irrigate his crops

loans.name: Sintia Rosio

texts.es:
La señorita   Sintia Rocio M. P.,  tiene 26  años de edad, vive en la comunidad de Churu de la  provincia de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba,   tiene un  hijo  su esposo trabaja en la construcción y ella se dedica a elaborar  pan y distribuir a las diferentes tiendas. 
  
Es muy querida y respetada en el pueblo de Mizque, por lo dedicada a su familia y su trabajo ella está solicitando el crédito para comprarse un horno industrial para aumentar su negocio y así  aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su condición de vida que llevan junto su hijo y su esposo y que sus hijos puedan asistir  a la escuela en mejores condiciones.  El crédito ayudara mucho en el duro trabajo que realiza juntamente con su esposo y su hijo.
texts.en:
Srta. Sintia Rocio M. P. is 26 years old and lives in the community of Churu in Mizque Province, Department of Cochabamba. She has one child. Her husband works in construction while she produces bread and distributes it to different stores.

Sintia is well-liked and respected in the town of Mizque. She is devoted to both her family and her job. Sintia is requesting a loan to buy an industrial oven so that she can expand her business and increase her income. This will enable her to improve her living conditions, as well as those of her child and husband, and help her child attend a school with better conditions. The loan will be a great help with all the hard work she accomplishes together with her husband and child.

loans.use: Purchase an industrial oven

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es:
El Señor Ariel S. O., El cliente curso hasta 4to. de Secundaria, es soltero y no tiene hijos, el trabaja en el magisterio en como profesor de primaria, e dedica al servicio de moto taxista en Ivirgarzama hace mas de 1 año, El vive solo ya como 4 años, es de escasos recursos ya que trabaja como chofer de moto taxi, el está afiliado al sindicato de moto taxista "CARRASCO", el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

 Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una, es por eso que solicita el crédito para ser independiente y poder tener su propia herramienta de trabajo y de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.

 Cabe señalar que el señor Ariel S. O. se apersono a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le  comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Sr. Ariel S. O. completed his education through the fourth year of high school. He is single and does not have children. Ariel works as an elementary school teacher, but he also has been providing his services as a motorcycle taxi driver in Ivirgarzama for more than a year. He has already lived on his own for four years and has limited resources from his job as a motorcycle taxi driver. Ariel is affiliated with the Carrasco taxi drivers union. The service he provides is profitable because he has many people in need of this form of transportation for its ease, speed, and efficiency. The union has stops and routes for each of its members at different points within the town of Ivirgarzama where people are requesting this service.

This is the first loan Ariel will receive from CIDRE. It will be used to purchase a motorcycle. He is requesting this loan so that he can be independent and have his own vehicle to use for work. This will help him provide better service to his customers and allow him to earn more income as well as improve his quality of life.

It should be noted that Sr. Ariel S. O. showed up to apply for his loan after his co-workers told him about the good credit terms being offered by CIDRE.

loans.use: Purchase a new vehicle for his work

loans.name: Santos Javier

texts.es:
Santos es un hombre trabajador, un padre muy dedicado a sus hijos, tiene su propio negocio la elaboración de muebles de madera, ya que su oficio es de ebanista.
Lleva varios años invirtiendo en madera, con préstamo de la institución, ha venido aumentar la capacidad de madera para hacer mas muebles lo que para él ha sido de gran beneficio por que ha logrado desarrollarse más y mover mas su capital.
También ha logrado comprar sus herramientas de trabajo, hoy en día va hacer varios encargos lo que comprara mucha madera, pliegos de lijas, laminas de fibras, galones de pinturas, galones de cellador, cener entre otros para dar el acabado a sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Santos is a hardworking gentleman and a devoted father to his children. He has his own business making wooden furniture since he is a cabinetmaker by trade.

He has invested in wood for several years, using loans from AFODENIC. This has helped increase his capacity to produce more furniture, but Santos says the greatest benefit has been the ability to continue developing, which allows him to move more of his capital.

Santos has also been able to buy tools for his job. At the moment he has several orders. He needs to buy plenty of wood, sheets of sandpaper, sheets of plywood, gallons of paint, gallons of sealant, and other supplies needed to finish his work.

loans.use: Purchase wood, sandpaper, plywood, paint, sealant, and other supplies needed to finish his work

loans.name: Sonia Jaqueline

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene carga familiar, reside junto a sus padres en una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella estudió enfermería y actualmente se encuentra brindando su servicio de modo independiente. Adicionalmente cuenta con una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado conformado por una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte), ella alquila este vehículo a un chofer particular que la utiliza diariamente.

El vehículo ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Sonia es una joven emprendedora que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer responsable y confiable.
texts.en:
Sonia is 22 years old, single, and has no family responsibilities.  She lives with her parents in a marginalized urban area of the city of Chiclayo.

Sonia studied nursing and currently provides her services as an independent worker.  In addition, she has a motorcycle taxi (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle with an attached cabin for providing transport services).  She rents out this vehicle to a designated driver on a daily basis.  

The vehicle currently suffers from a few malfunctions that require urgent repairs to ensure proper operation.  For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 PEN so that she can meet this objective.

Sonia is a young entrepreneur who has tremendous desire to succeed.  The people who know her consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy woman.

loans.use: Vehicle repairs & maintenance

loans.name: Lilia Gloria

texts.es:
Lila tiene 45 años D. edad, es casada y tiene doce hijos D. los cuales tres están viviendo con ella. Vive junto a su madre en el anexo San Luis del distrito D. La Victoria, una zona rural que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Lila se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales menores en su domicilio. Cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta en los mercados Modelo y Moshoqueque D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, usualmente va a estos centros D. abasto dos veces por mes. Adicionalmente cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en un ambiente D. su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos verduras, frutas y algunos abarrotes. Los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades son utilizados para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

Lila desea adquirir mas productos para surtir su bodega y aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Lila is 45 years old, married, and has twelve children. Three of them still live with her. She also lives with her mother in the San Luis Annex of the District of La Victoria, a rural area located 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Lila raises and sells small animals from her home. When the animals have reached the proper stage of development, she offers them for sale at the Modelo and Moshoqueque Markets in the city of Chiclayo. She usually visits the markets twice per month. In addition, she has a small grocery store established in a room in her house. There she offers her neighbors vegetables, fruits, and other grocery products. The earnings generated from her businesses have been useful in helping her husband with the family finances.

Lila wants to acquire more products so that she can restock her store and increase her sales. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can accomplish her goal.

Lila is a peaceful and responsible woman. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so that she can proviD. her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities for her store

loans.name: Guillermo Alberto

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene la edad de 42 años, casado, con tres hermosos hijos, siendo su esposa comerciante.
Mi trabajo que hago es el servicio de taxi, que día a día recorro la capital de Managua. Iniciando como cadete, luego con ahorros logre comprar un carro usado que he venido dando mantenimiento para lograr mejorar la condición del motor.
Decide un financiamiento ya que desea  pintar el vehículo, y cambiar unas piezas lo que no cuenta con todo el dinero y quiere mejorar la condición física ya que es su medio de trabajo.
Lo que esta animado por el apoyo de la institución en donde podrá proceder con el objetivo de mejorar su trabajo como mejores utilidades para el bienestar de su familia
texts.en:
Guillermo is 42 years old.  He is married and has three beautiful children.  His wife is a trader.  “My work is providing a taxi service.  Every day I work in the capital city Managua.  I began as a young man then with my savings I managed to buy a used car which I have been maintaining in order to improve the condition of  its engine”.

Guillermo is requesting a loan because he would like to give his vehicle a paint job and replace some parts.  He does not have enough money to do this but he would like to change his vehicle's physical appearance since it is his means of work.

He is motivated by the support of our organization as it will allow him to proceed with his goal of improving his work and obtain better profits for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: To maintain his taxi with a paint job and some spare parts for his engine which will enable him to provide a better service

loans.name: Jose Ines

texts.es:
José Ines es un padre de familia de 54 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Tamborreal del distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde que era joven, actualmente cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde suele senbrar granos y hortalizas. El vende sus productos una vez cosechados en los mercados mayoristas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Con los ingresos que el obtiene de estas actividades se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

Actualmente ha sembrado maíz en su terreno y se encuentra brindando mantenimiento para poder conseguir una buena cosecha. Por ello ha decidido comprar diversos abonos y pesticidas con los cuales espera conseguir su objetivo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

José es una persona bastante trabajadora y que siempre vela por el desarrollo y bienestar de su familia. En la zona donde vive las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo y de confianza.
texts.en:
José is a 54-year-old father who lives with his wife and children the Tamborreal village of the Pítipo district, an agricultural zone an hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

He has worked in agriculture since he was young and now owns a small piece of land where he cultivates seeds and vegetables. He sells his products once they're harvested in the wholesale markets of Chiclayo. With his earnings from this activity he makes sure his family gets ahead. 

Currently he has planted corn on his land and dedicates himself to its maintenance in order to obtain a good harvest. For this reason he has decided to buy various fertilizers and pesticides with which he hopes to achieve his goal. He is requesting his first loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 500 nuevos soles. 

José is a very hard-working man and always watches over the development and well-being of his family. In the area where he lives people know him as a peaceful and reliable person.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his corn crop

loans.name: Cevigna Estela

texts.es:
Cevigna es una madre D. familia D. 52 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su familia en el distrito D. Olmos, una zona agrícola D. regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia D. Lambayeque, a más D. una hora y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir y sandalias en un puesto ubicado en el mercado D. su distrito. El negocio cuenta con buena acogida y con demanda permanente ya que su distrito está conformado por varios caseríos cuyos pobladores se dirigen semanalmente al pueblo central para adquirir diversos productos. Los ingresos que obtiene D. esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. los gastos familiares.

Cevigna desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas prendas D. vestir para poder aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante tranquila y conocida en la zona, las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona responsable y D. confianza.
texts.en:
Cevigna is a 52-year-old mother who lives with her family in the Olmos district, an agricultural zone located in the Lambayeque province, over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. 

She sells clothing and sandals in a stand located in her district's market. Her business has received a good reception and permanent demand because her district is maD. up for various villages whose residents arrive weekly to the central village to purchase various products. The income that she makes from this activity is used to help her husband and to cover her family's expenses. 

Cevigna wishes to expand her business by purchasing more clothing and increase her sales. For this reason she has requested a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 nuevos soles. 

She is a very peaceful woman, known in the area by those who know her as a responsible and reliable person.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es:
Flor D. 36 años D. edad, resiD. en San Jorge, departamento D. San Miguel, se dedica a la venta D. Frutas y verduras, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos D. 6, 8 y 11 años D. edad, dependen económicamente D. ellos; El negocio fue iniciativa propia iniciándolo en el 2004 con la ayuda D. su esposo, los clientes son vecinos del lugar y personas que visitan el pueblo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. Bananos, manzanas, chiles, zanahorias y otras más que son frecuentemente buscadas por los clientes, esta inversión ayudara a que Flor cuente con mas mercadería y pueda generar más ingresos para solventar las necesidades D. su hogar.
Flor aspira crecer con su negocio para que este le dé estabilidad a los ingresos del hogar, para sacar adelante a sus hijos y puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Flor, 36, lives in San Jorge, San Miguel department.  She is a fruit and vegetable merchant.  She lives with her husband and three children who are 6, 8 and 11 years of age and economically dependent on their children.  She started the business on her own initiative in 2004 with help from her husband.  Customers are neighbors and visitors to the town.

She is asking for a loan to buy plantains, apples, chilies, carrots and others that are the most sought after by customers.  This investment will help Flor have more merchandise thus generating higher income to meet household expenses.

Flor hopes to grow with her business so that it will proviD. economic stability to the home thus managing to raise her children so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ines Cordero

texts.es:
Don Inés es un señor trabajador él está ya jubilado, vive con su esposa y tienen 2 hijos de 25 y 30 años de edad, pero estos ya no dependen económicamente de él, este negocio lo inicio con su esposa y lo tienen ubicado en el mercado de San Jorge, ya que ellos viven ahí precisamente en el municipio de San Jorge departamento de San Miguel, ya tienen bastante clientela y son muy conocidos.
Actualmente él solicita un préstamo para la compra de aceite, azúcar, pollo, papel higiénico entre otros que forman parte de los productos que ofrece a los clientes, esta inversión le dará mayor estabilidad y mejor atención, su objetivo es tener un negocio más rentable y recibir mejores ingresos que le mejoren su calidad de vida y la de su esposa.
texts.en:
Inés is a hard-working man who is already retired.  He lives with his wife and they have 2 children aged 25 and 30 who are no longer financially dependent on him.  He started this business with his wife and it is located in the San Jorge market since they live in the town of San Jorge in San Miguel department.  They have a lot of customers and are very well known.

Currently he is requesting a loan to buy oil, sugar, chicken, toilet paper and other products which he offers to his customers.  This investment will give him better stability and allow him to offer a better service.  His goal is to have a more profitable business and to receive better income which will improve his quality of life and that of his wife.

loans.use: To buy basic food products such as oil, sugar and chicken

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Don Luis, su oficio es  la sastrería, tiene 49 años de edad, reside en Berlín departamento de Usulután donde vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 17 y 18 años de edad, la sastrería la inicio hace 25 años no tiene un horario fijo de atención ya que la tiene ubicada en su propia casa de habitación, por lo que es difícil tener un horario.
Él quiere invertir en materiales para la sastrería por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas de diferentes tipos y colores además comprar hilos, botones que son parte para la confección de ropa, esta inversión ayudara a que su inventario de telas cuente con la diversificación de colores a disposición de los clientes permitiéndole dar una mejor atención a ellos y ofrecerles lo que necesitan.
Para Don Luis los objetivos con respecto a la sastrería es mejorar cada día, brindar un buen servicio, aumentar el número de clientes y mejorar los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a tailor, he is 49 years old and lives in the Berlin department of Usulutan with his wife and 2 children, who are 17 and 18 years old. He started his tailor shop 25 years ago. He does not have a set schedule, as the shop is set up in his home, which makes it difficult to establish a schedule.
He would like to invest in materials for his tailor shop, for which he is requesting a loan to purchase different types and colors of fabric, as well as thread and buttons, to produce clothes. This investment will help him diversify the inventory of fabrics available to his customers, so he can better attend to them and their needs.
For Luis, the goals for his tailor shop are to improve every day, offer good service, increase the number of customers and increase his family's income.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread and buttons

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: La señora Carmen Rosa H. G. se dedica a la actividad de recicladora hace más de dos años. Es casada, su esposo trabaja como técnico electricista por lo cual cuenta con un ingreso adicional y ambos se ayudan en la canasta familiar. Está solicitando el crédito para mejoramiento de su vivienda la cual es propia y tener mejor calidad de vida. Se propone otorgarle el crédito ya que no tiene experiencia crediticia y es la primera vez que requiere de un crédito, además cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en: Carmen Rosa H. G. has been working in recycling for 2 years. She is married, and her husband works as an electrician, so they have additional income and both contribute to the family budget. She is requesting a loan to improve her home, which she owns, and improve their quality of life. She hopes to receive credit although she does not have a credit history and this is the first time she is requesting a loan. She has good personal and work references.

loans.use: personal expenses

loans.name: Paola Marily

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Jazmines  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujer y Fortaleza.

En este lugar encontramos y conocimos a la señora Paola, tiene 23 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y en la actualidad está esperando un hijo, está en su segundo mes de embarazo, su marido es chofer y trabaja en Manta.

Se dedica al comercio, vende productos de la marca Esika (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas), trabaja los fines de semana desde las 9am hasta las 16h00, en estos días  enseña la revista, anota los pedidos y luego realiza los pedidos a la empresa, recibe los productos en su casa y entrega los productos a sus clientas a quienes les da facilidades de pago, les cobra por semana o cada quince días, nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio ya 4 años y que le ha ido bien  ya que con esto ha podido aportar a los gastos del hogar.

Este crédito es para pagar el pedido de este mes. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal le gusta porque aquí se cumplen bien todos los reglamentos y normas. Su sueño es tener su propio bazar.
texts.en:
The members of the 'Mujer y Fortaleza' (Woman and Strength) community bank meet every fortnight in Los Jazmines, in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as 'the city of the royal tamarind trees'.

Here we find and meet 23 year-old Paola.  Paola lives with her common-law husband and she is currently expecting a baby.  She is two months pregnant.  Her husband is a driver and works in Manta.

Paola sells Esika brand products (beauty products, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works weekends from 9.00am to 4.00pm.  She shows her catalog to her customers, makes a note of their orders and then transmits the orders to the company.  She receives the products at home and then delivers them to her customers who she provides with easy repayment terms.  She collects her money every week or every fortnight.  She tells us that she has been in this business for 4 years and that it has done well and allowed her to help with her household expenses.

This loan will be used to pay for this month's order.  This is the second loan cycle for Paola's community bank.  She likes the bank because all the rules and regulations are properly observed.  Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, perfume and costume jewelry

loans.name: Ana Leopoldina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Jazmines  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujer y Fortaleza.

La señora Ana es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución como por ejemplo el seguro de vida. Tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación ha tenido tres hijos, ya todos son mayores de edad. Su marido es empleado público.

Ella es profesora de profesión y da clases en un colegio de la ciudad, pero  también se dedica al comercio, tiene un local en su casa donde vende bisuterías y algunas cosas de bazar, trabaja en las mañanas ya que en las tardes se dedica a su labor en el colegio donde trabaja, allí también les vende a sus compañeras de trabajo. Compra su mercadería en Guayaquil y otras a artesanas de la localidad.

Este nuevo crédito es para comprar más mercadería y surtir aun más su negocio. Sus metas son jubilarse y dedicarse de lleno a su negocio que quisiera ampliarlo y tener un gran bazar.
texts.en:
The members of the Mujer y Fortaleza [Woman and Fortitude] Village Bank meet every fifteen days in the Los Jazmines neighborhood, in Portoviejo, which the capitol of Manabí province, and has been known for many years as the city of "Los Reales Tamarindos" [a soccer stadium].  

Ana is a founding member of the village bank and she likes the added benefits she gets, like life insurance. She's sixty-years-old, married, and from her marriage has had three children, all grown.  Her husband is a public employee.

Ana is a teacher by trade and teaches at a school in the city. She also has a business in her home, where she sells jewelry and assorted goods during the mornings; in the afternoons she teaches at the school and also sells to her coworkers.  She buys some of her merchandise in Guayaquil and some from local artisans.

Her latest loan is to buy merchandise to stock up her store even more.  He plan is to retire and work full-time at the store, which she would like to expand to have a big bazaar.

loans.use: To buy jewelry and assorted goods to sell.

loans.name: Mayra Jahaira

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Jazmines  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujer y Fortaleza.

Aquí conocimos a Mayra, ella es una linda señorita que tiene 22 años de edad, está soltera y vive con su hermana y su abuela. Estudia el primer año de Derecho  en la ULEAM. Además trabaja de secretaria en una Notaria de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y está muy contenta, le gusta  las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.

Además de trabajar como secretaria se dedica al comercio, vende ropa, carteras y accesorios  para damas, aprovecha para venderles a sus compañeras y amigas de la universidad en las noches y también recorre con sus productos los sábados y domingos en las mañanas, deja a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince días. Sus productos se los mandan desde Panamá, una señora que vive allá le envía la mercadería.

Este crédito es para pagar el pedido que va a recibir ya que tiene que pagar adelantado los pedidos. Sus sueños son terminar su carrera y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
The members of the 'Mujer y Fortaleza' (Woman and Strength) community bank meet every fortnight in Los Jazmines, in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as 'the city of the royal tamarind trees'.

Here we meet Mayra.  She is a pretty young lady who is 22 years old.  She is single and lives with her sister and her grandmother.  She is in her first year of a law degree at ULEAM.  She also works as a secretary in a notary's office in the city of Portoviejo.  This is her first loan cycle with the community bank and she is very happy.  She likes the ease with which she can acquire a loan.

As well as working as a secretary, Mayra is also a saleswoman.  She sells ladies' clothes, purses and accessories.  She sells them to her friends and university classmates in the evenings.  She also sells her products on Saturday and Sunday mornings.  She leaves the goods on credit and collects payment for them every week or every fortnight.  She receives her products from Panama.  A lady who lives there sends them to her.

Mayra will use this loan to pay for the order which she is going to receive since she has to pay for her orders up front.  Her dreams are to finish her university course and work in her chosen profession.

loans.use: To buy ladies' clothes, purses and accessories

loans.name: Amalia Cecilia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Jazmines  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujer y Fortaleza.

La señora Amalia es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades de pago que da  la institución y por los intereses bajos. Tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 15 años de edad que está en el colegio, el marido es empleado público.

Se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, la misma que vende en su casa donde sus clientas llegan cuando sabe que ha traído mercadería, ya que la ropa que ella trae desde Guayaquil es de muy buena calidad y en modelos bonitos y a gusto de sus clientes, también vende ropa intima de damas, trabaja todos los días desde las 15h00 hasta las 21h0 ya que es a esa hora que sus clientas llegan ya que durante el día todas ellas trabajan.

Este crédito es justamente para ir a Guayaquil a comprar ropa. Su meta es seguir trabajando y algún día poner una boutique.
texts.en:
The members of the 'Mujer y Fortaleza' (Woman and Strength) community bank meet every fortnight in Los Jazmines, in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as 'the city of the royal tamarind trees'.

Amalia is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it because of the ease of making payments and the low interest rates.  She is 40 years old and married.  She has a 15 year old son who attends school.  Her husband is a government employee.

Amalia is a saleswoman.  She sells all kinds of clothes.  She sells the clothes from her home where her customers come when they know that she has brought merchandise because she brings clothes from Guayaquil.  The clothes are very good quality, good styles and to her customers' tastes.  She also sells ladies' underwear.  She works every day from 3.00pm to 9.00pm since this is when her customers get home from work.

She will use this loan to travel to Guayaquil to buy clothes.  Her goal is to continue working and some day to set up her own boutique.

loans.use: To buy all kinds of ladies' clothes and underwear

loans.name: Patricia Alejandra

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Jazmines  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujer y Fortaleza.

En este lugar encontramos a Patricia, ella tiene 28 años y es madre soltera de un hijo de 8 años de edad que estudia en la escuela, vive en la casa de sus padres, estudia Derecho en la Universidad San Gregorio de Portoviejo. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades de pago.

Ella tiene una furgoneta que la utiliza como transporte escolar, muy de mañana se levanta y sale a hacer su recorrido diario parra levar a sus estudiantes a los diferentes centros de estudio, realiza esto dos veces en las mañanas y dos en las tardes. Trabaja de lunes a viernes y los domingos cuando le fletan su transporte para viajes turísticos.

Este crédito es para pagar la pensión del semestre en su universidad. Sus sueños son terminar su carrera y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
In the region "Los Jazmines" of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the communal bank "Mujer y Fortaleza" ["Woman and Strength"] get together every two weeks.

In this place we meet Patricia, who is 28 years old and is a single mother of an 8 year old boy that studies in school. She lives in her parents' house and studies Law at the University "San Gregorio de Portoviejo". This is her third cycle in the communal bank, and she likes it because of the ease of payment.

She has a van that she uses as school transportation. She gets up very early in the morning and goes out to do her daily route to pick up her students at the different schools. She does this two times in the morning and two times in the afternoon. She works from Monday through Friday and on Sundays when they hire her transportation for field trips.

This loan is to pay for the tuition for a semester at the University. Her dream is to finish her degree and practice her profession.

loans.use: To pay for tuition for a semester at the University.

loans.name: Delia Ercilia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Constructoras Del Éxito, esta ciudad se la conoce desde hace mucho con el nombre de Ciudad Del Valle por estar encerrada por muchos cerros que rodean la urbe.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Delia, tiene 32 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 10 y 7 años los mismos que estudian en la escuela. El marido es músico. Estudio estética y estilismo en la Academia Manuela Cañizares de la ciudad de Portoviejo.
 
Es estilista y trabaja en una peluquería, realiza trabajos a domicilios en sus tiempos libres y los sabados que tiene libre realiza trabajos casi todo el día,hace tinturados y corte de cabellos, pinta las uñas y otros trabajos mas, aprovecha las noches para dedicarse a su trabajo ya que en el día trabaja en un salón de belleza. Además de esto también vende productos naturales cuando realiza sus otros trabajos.

Este crédito es para comprar productos naturales y para comprar más herramientas de trabajo. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal. Su deseo es tener un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
The “Constructoras Del Éxito” (Builders of Success) communal bank meets in Portoviejo every two weeks.  This city has been known for a long time as City of the Valley because the city is surrounded by many hills.

We find Delia, 32, here.  She is in a common law relationship and has two children who are 10 and 7 years of age and who go to school.  Her husband is a musician.  She studied hair styling and esthetics at the Manuela Cañizares Academy in Portoviejo.

She is a hair stylist and works in a barber shop.  On her free time and all day on Saturday, which is her day off, she performs these services at customers’ homes.  She does hair coloring, hair cuts, applies nail polish and other tasks.  She does most of these jobs at night because during the day she’s employed at the beauty salon.  In addition to this she also sells natural products while performing the other jobs.

This loan is to buy natural products and to buy more work tools.  She is a founding member of the communal bank.  Her wish is to have her own beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies like: dyes, nail polish, tools and natural products.

loans.name: Beatriz Katherine

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Constructoras Del Éxito, esta ciudad se la conoce desde hace mucho con el nombre de Ciudad Del Valle por estar encerrada por muchos cerros que rodean la urbe.

La señora Beatriz lleva en el Banco Comunal ya siete ciclos y está muy contenta y agradecida por los beneficios que ha recibido en este tiempo. Ella tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 5 años y otro de 10 meses, la mayor esta en primero de básica. El marido es comerciante.

Ella además de atender a sus hijos y su hogar también se dedica al comercio, vende productos naturales, trabaja de lunes a viernes de dos a tres horas al día, visita a sus clientes que ya tiene y le lleva los productos, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, lo que mas vende son productos para los riñones y el hígado, también las personas compran bastantes  adelgazantes y energizantes.

Este crédito es para comprar sus productos para luego llevarlos a entregar ya que la mayor parte ya los tiene encargados. Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the Communal Bank “Constructoras del Éxito” (Builders of Success) meets every fifteen days. This city has long been known as the “City of the Valley” because of the many surrounding hills.

Sra. Beatriz has already participated in seven loan cycles with the Communal Bank. She is very pleased and grateful for the benefits she has received during this time. Beatriz is 20 years old and in a common law marriage. She has two children, ages 5 and 10 months. Her oldest child is in first grade while her husband works as a merchant.

In addition to caring for her children and looking after her household, Beatriz sells natural products. She works Monday through Friday, two to three hours each day, visiting her customers and delivering products. Beatriz extends credit and collects payment every fifteen days. The products she sells most are for the kidneys and the liver. Her customers also buy weight loss remedies and energy supplements.

This loan will be used to buy more products for delivery since she already has a large number of orders. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: Purchase weight loss remedies, energy supplements, and other natural products

loans.name: Amparo Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Constructoras Del Éxito, esta ciudad se la conoce desde hace mucho con el nombre de Ciudad Del Valle por estar encerrada por muchos cerros que rodean la urbe.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Amparo, tiene 35 años de edad y es madre de 5 hijos, nos cuenta que hace muchos años se separo y quedo sola con sus hijos, tres de ellos estudian en el colegio y dos en la escuela, construyo una casita en el terreno de la mamá donde vive con sus hijos.

Tiene un negocio de compra y venta de arroz, trabaja todos los días, contrata un carro que la lleva hasta una piladora de arroz en San Jacinto donde compra el arroz a mas bajo precio, luego se dirige a Portoviejo donde tiene sus clientes a quienes les entrega por quintal o por saquillos de 25 libras, su hija mayor le ayuda en sus ventas cuando tiene tiempo.

Este crédito es para invertirlo en comprar arroz para la venta diaria ya que el capital esta invertido por que deja a crédito. Tiene en el Banco Comunal ya 4 años y le gusta por las facilidades de pago. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia y un buen local para guardar su mercadería.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the Communal Bank “Constructoras del Éxito” (Builders of Success) meets every fifteen days. This city has long been known as the “City of the Valley” because of the many surrounding hills.

Sra. Amparo is 35 years old and the mother of five children. She says that she has been separated for many years and was left alone with her children. Three of her children are high school students while the other two are in elementary school. Amparo and her children live in a house that she built on her mother’s land.

She has a business of buying and selling rice. Amparo works every day. She rents a car so that she can travel to a rice husker in San Jacinto where she is able to buy rice at a very low price. Afterwards she goes to Portoviejo where she has many customers who buy rice by the “quintal” (1 quintal = 46kg) or in 25 pound sacks. Her oldest daughter helps her with making sales whenever she has time.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of rice to sell each day since her existing capital was used for extending credit. Amparo has been a member of the Communal Bank for four years and enjoys the convenient payments. Her dreams include having a house of her own and a store where she can keep her merchandise.

loans.use: Purchase rice

loans.name: Elida Carmita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Constructoras Del Éxito, esta ciudad se la conoce desde hace mucho con el nombre de Ciudad Del Valle por estar encerrada por muchos cerros que rodean la urbe.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Elida,  ella tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha tenido tres hijos de 17, 11 y 9 años, la mayor este año termina el colegio y los menores están en la escuela. Su marido vende periódicos. 

Ella se dedica a la venta de yogurt por litros, el mismo que lo recibe de la ciudad de Quito que es donde fabrican este producto, ella recibe en su casa de dos a cuatro  veces por semana, una vez que recibe el producto, sale a recorrer con sus productos, vende a personas de su localidad y en tiendas a las que deja a buen precio, dice que aunque gane poco lo importante es vender. Trabaja todos los días en sus ventas desde las 7am hasta las 11am, lleva tres años en este negocio.
 
Este crédito es para comprar el producto ya que tiene que pagar por adelantado. Hace tres años es socia del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras siempre están atentas a las necesidades de las otras socias. Su sueño es tener algún día su propia fábrica.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the Communal Bank “Constructoras del Éxito” (Builders of Success) meets every fifteen days. This city has long been known as the “City of the Valley” because of the many surrounding hills.

Sra. Elida is 36 years old and in a common law marriage. She has three children (ages 17, 11, and 9). Her oldest child finishes high school this year and the younger children are in elementary school. Her husband sells newspapers.

Elida sells yogurt by the liter. Her product comes from the city of Quito where it is made. The yogurt is delivered to her house 2-4 times per week. As soon as she receives her product, she goes out to sell it to customers in her community and to stores at a good price. Elida says it is very important for her to make sales even though she may not earn much. She works every day making sales from 7am to 11am. Her business has been in operation for three years.

This loan will be used to buy yogurt since she must pay for the product in advance. Elida has been a member of the Communal Bank for three years. She likes the fact that her fellow members are attentive to the needs of all the others. Her dream is to have her own factory one day.

loans.use: Purchase yogurt

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Constructoras Del Éxito, esta ciudad se la conoce desde hace mucho con el nombre de Ciudad Del Valle por estar encerrada por muchos cerros que rodean la urbe.

Para la señora María este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque se siente cómoda en el Banco. Tiene 37 años de edad, está divorciada y de esa relación tuvieron dos hijos de 17 y de 13 años, los mismos que están en el colegio y la mayor en la Universidad.

Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ropa y zapatos, todos estos productos son de catalogo, además fabrica y vende especias, las mismas que entrega a una distribuidora local, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 18h00, lo que es ropa y zapatos los deja a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince días.

Este crédito es para comprar más de sus productos en especial ropa de damas. Sus sueños son tener un gran almacén o una fábrica de especias bien estructurada.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the Communal Bank “Constructoras del Éxito” (Builders of Success) meets every fifteen days. This city has long been known as the “City of the Valley” because of the many surrounding hills.

Sra. María is in her third loan cycle with the Communal Bank and likes the fact that she feels comfortable in her group. She is divorced and has two chidren, ages 17 and 13. One child is in high school while her oldest is attending university.

María sells cosmetics, clothing, and shoes from a catalog. In addition, she prepares spices and delivers them to a local distributor. She works every day from 8am to 6pm. María sells clothing and shoes on credit and collects payment weekly or every fifteen days.

This loan will be used to buy more products, especially women’s clothing. Her dreams include having a large warehouse or a spice factory that is well-structured.

loans.use: Purchase women's clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and spices

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna is the father of one daughter. He owns an olive wood workshop in Bethlehem where he produces items for tourists, such as crosses, domes of the rock, etc.

Due to the financial crisis, Hanna has had some financial trouble as the shops he sells his items to have not been able to pay for their purchases from him. Hanna has had to borrow money from relatives to keep running the workshop. 

Hanna came to FATEN and asked for a $1500 loan. He will use the loan to pay his daughter's school tuition fees and to repay his relatives.

Hanna appears in the picture above in FATEN's office in Bethlehem.

loans.use: To pay his daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela B. is a married woman who lives in Dacongcogon, Barangay Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, buying and selling rice and a catering/food vending business. Her husband, Ricardo B. Sr., who is 62 years old, also helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are 31 to 43 years old. 

Rafaela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rafaela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $200, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 5th cycle loan, she is again borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future family needs and the payment of debts. Rafaela B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

Julita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family.

This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing 29,000 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for more feed for her piggery and to buy an additional hog to raise so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Julita A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

Angeles M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Elizaveta

texts.en:
Elizaveta is a widow. She is a small entrepreneur from Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Elizaveta sells home appliances. She launched her venture a year ago. Currently, she has 25,000 UAH worth of inventory. Her monthly net profit is approximately $406. 

Elizaveta is seeking a loan of 6,500 UAH to purchase additional merchandise and gain extra income as a result. Consistent demand and entrepreneurial enthusiasm will guarantee loan repayment without any delinquencies.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with a 3-year-old son. He is a small farmer from Kamenka. Alexander grows early spring vegetables. He owns a nice big greenhouse where he grows his vegetables and a smaller one for seedlings. Alexander has been in this business for four years. He has already invested about 40,000 UAH in this business. 

Alexander is planning to invest a loan of 10,000 UAH in the purchase and installation of a heating unit for his greenhouse. A nice heating system, properly chosen and installed, will help maintain uniform temperatures and positively affect the micro-climate for the plants Alexander grows in his greenhouse. Besides vegetables, Alexander also grows fruit, such as plums, cherries, etc. He owns a small van to transport his produce to the marketplaces in his region.

loans.use: to install a heating unit in his greenhouse

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two grown children. She is a farming entrepreneur from Kamenka, which is a predominantly agricultural region of south-eastern Ukraine. Irina grows vegetables in greenhouses and then sells them in the markets wholesale or retail. She owns two spacious arch greenhouses and a smaller one for seedlings. Irina has rich experience working in this business. She has been growing vegetables for 32 years. She has invested 35,000 UAH in her venture.  

Irina is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase additional polyethylene film and seeds for the upcoming greenhouse farming season. She is hoping to generate additional income. Irina is planning to invest it by installing heating units in her greenhouses. It should be noted that farming businesses are very common for this region, which is predominantly agricultural.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and polyethylene film for greenhouse

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda T. is a married woman who lives in Purok 8, Brgy. San Jose, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a piggery. Her husband, Rolly, who is 37 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are aged between 6 and 13 years old.

Criselda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Criselda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000 thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she intends to use to buy stocks for the general store and feed for the piggery, so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and the expansion of her piggery. Criselda T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference to the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva Lending Team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is married with a two-year-old daughter. He is a farmer from Velikaya Znamenka. Alexei grows early spring vegetables i.e. radishes, tomatoes, etc. to sell in the markets of his region. He owns two big arch greenhouses, one for seedlings and four smaller ones for tomatoes. Moreover, he also has a tractor which helps him generate additional income in spring when he plows fields for other farmers in his region. Alexei has been growing vegetables for three years. He has already invested 50,000 Grivnyas in this business. He spends about 12,000 Grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene film every year. 

Alexei is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase polyethylene film and additional seeds for next farming season. He can be characterized as a hard-working businessman with good potential for further business development. Alexei is hoping to generate additional income and eventually construct two more arch greenhouses. He has enough land and has permission to build on it. Alexei’s wife is expecting, which is why he is ready and willing to work extra hard to provide for all the family needs.

loans.use: To purchase polyethylene film and seeds

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn C. is a married woman who lives in Purok 3, Brgy. San Jose, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, a rice retailer and a ready-to-wear clothes business. Her husband, Simproso, who is 53 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are aged between 10 and 22 years old. 

Merilyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 29 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Merilyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,500 thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 30th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 which she intends to use to buy stocks for the general store and her rice retailing business so that she can continue to save for future improvements to her businesses and the education of her children. Merilyn C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.
