loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married and has two grown daughters. She runs a small business in the market of Novaya Kahovka selling children’s clothing. There are very few others in the market who are engaged in this trade.

Tatyana has been in this business for 10 years. Her natural ability to assess the business environment and take advantage of it will help her to achieve independence and security in her business and life.

Tatyana is requesting a loan of 15,000 Ukrainian grivnas (UAH) to increase her seasonal inventory. From this, she hopes to receive additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is divorced with two grown children. She is an entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk. Nataliya used to work as a deputy director at a knitting factory. However, it was closed down and she was forced to launch her own business. Now, Nataliya sells men’s suits, pants, and shirts in the central marketplace of her hometown. She offers a nice selection of assorted inventory at affordable prices. Nataliya has been in this trade for 10 years. This business is the main source of income for Nataliya. Her monthly profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnas. She hopes to continue growing her business in the future.

Nataliya is seeking a loan of 11,000 Grivnas to purchase 50 winter coats for further retail sale.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Mujeres En Progreso (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres en Progreso está formado por 12 mujeres que viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza arquitectónica, sus cuatro ríos que bañan la ciudad, su gente que conservan su cultura y tradiciones. Nuestras socias son mujeres que siempre tienen una sonrisa en sus labios a pesar de sus adversidades, con su trabajo diario luchan cada día para entregarles un mejor bienestar a sus familias.

La Señorita. María Méndez vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, es el segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, fue invitada por su prima y en este tiempo ha llegado a tener una muy buena amistad con todas las socias. Nuestra socia está estudiando en la universidad, en los actuales momentos está realizando el internado para obtener su titulo. También en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos Avon,  vende a sus compañeras en la universidad y realiza esta actividad hace dos años y medio. 
La Señorita. María tiene 24 años,  es soltera pero tiene una hija de un año y medio, vive con sus padres. Su mamá es comerciante y su padre se encuentra fuera del país, ha migrando en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo. El dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en los gastos de sus estudios. Su meta es especializarse en cirugías.

La Señora. Carmen Álvarez vive en la parroquia de Santa Ana, tiene 49 años,  es casada y tiene 4 hijo de 29, 25, 22 y 9 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven  independientes, su tercera hija estudia en la universidad y su último hijo estudia en la escuela. Su esposo labora como guardia privado, con el trabajo conyugal y esfuerzo mutuo han logrado construir su casa propia.
Doña Carmen es conserje hace nueve años en una escuela, lugar en el cual le dan una casa para que viva aparte de su casa propia, trabaja todo el día allí y se da  tiempo para dedicarse a la cría de chanchos. Es socia de la banca comunal hace dos años y los créditos le han servido para el alimento de sus animales, este nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento y también para comprar materiales para realizar los acabados de su casa. Su meta es  tener un vehiculo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres en Progreso communal bank consists of 12 women who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  The city is known for its architectural beauty, its four rivers that run through the city, and its people, who preserve its culture and traditions.  Our members are women who are always smiling in spite of their hardships, and with their work they fight each day to bring a better life to their families.

Miss María Méndez lives in the Totoracocha section of Cuenca.  This is her second loan with the communal bank.  She was invited to join by her cousin, and since then she has become very good friends with all the members.  She is studying at the university, and right now she is doing an internship in order to obtain her degree.  Also, in her free time, for the past two and a half years she has sold Avon cosmetics to her university classmates.  María is 24 years old and is single, but she has a one-and-a-half-year old daughter.  She lives with her parents.  Her mother is a merchant and her father is outside the country, having migrated in search of better work opportunities.  The money from her new loan will go toward the cost of her studies.  Her goal is to specialize in surgery.

Mrs. Carmen Álvarez lives in the parish of Santa Ana.  She is 49 years old and married with 4 children, who are 29, 25, 22, and 9 years old.  Her two oldest children are married and live independently.  Her third child, a daughter, is a student at the university, and her youngest, a son, is at school.  Her husband works as a private guard.  With their shared work and mutual effort they have been able to build their own house.

For nine years, Carmen has been a custodian at a school, where they give her a house to live in away from her own home.  She works all day there and has time to raise pigs.  She has been a member of the communal bank for two years, and the loans have helped her to buy feed for the animals.  This new loan will go toward the purchase of feed and also to buy materials to finish her house.  Her goal is to have a car.

loans.use: To pay for schooling / To buy animal feed and to finish construction work

loans.name: Diana Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora Diana A. es socia del banco comunal Las Estrellitas, vive por el sector del Descanso en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la  cultura de su gente y  sus tradiciones, cuenta con grandes paisajes para admirar y disfrutar, su centro histórico fue nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad.

La Señora. Diana tiene 43 años, es madre soltera de 6 hijos que tienen 22, 20, 17, 15, 14 y 12 años de edad, su primer hijo se dedica a trabajar pero es para sus gastos, su segunda hija es casada y tiene 3 hijos vive en su casa y comparten los gastos, su tercera hija también es casada pero vive independiente, su cuarta hija pasa en casa y ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar, su quinto hijo trabaja como ayudante en la construcción y su ultimo hija también pasa en casa ya que no le gusta estudiar. Hace muy poco tiempo ha logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña Diana es comerciante ambulante, se dedica a vender limpiones para la cocina, tapetes y varios artículos mas, actividad que la realiza hace veinte años, labora todos los días desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde.

Es nuestra socia hace tres años y los créditos anteriores la han ayudado para el incremento de su mercadería,  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mas limpiones, tapetes etc. Su sueño es  construir otra casa para darles a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Diana A. is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Estrellitas” (The Little Stars). She lives in the Descanso sector of the city of Cuenca, which is known for the culture of its people and its traditions. The city has grand views to admire and enjoy. Its historical center was recognized as a World Heritage Site.

Sra. Diana is 43 years old and a single mother with six children (ages 22, 20, 17, 15, 14, and 12). Her oldest son works but only to cover his expenses. Her second daughter is married, lives with her at home, and shares in the expenses. The third daughter is also married, but lives independently. Her fourth daughter stays at home and helps with the housework. The fifth child, a son, works as a construction assistant. The youngest, a daughter, also stays at home because she does not like to study. Only recently has Diana been able to build her own home.

Doña Diana is a traveling merchant. She sells kitchen towels, rugs, and many other items. Diana has been in this business for 20 years and works every day from 8am to 4pm.

She has been a member of the Communal Bank for three years and the previous loans have helped to increase her inventory of merchandise. This new loan will be invested in more kitchen towels, rugs, and other items. Her dream is to build another house to give to her children.

loans.use: Purchase kitchen towels & rugs

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
La Señora Luz F. es socia del banco comunal Las Estrellitas, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la  cultural de su gente y sus tradiciones, cuenta con grandes paisajes para admirar y disfrutar, su centro histórico fue nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad.

Nuestra socia es comerciante, hace dos años se dedica a vender productos para la higiene o artículos de temporada, solo los días miércoles vende pijamas, todos sus productos los vende recorriendo la ciudad, sale a vender después de enviar a sus hijos al colegio y escuela.

Doña Luz tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 14, 12, 7, 4 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primaras hija estudian en el colegio, su hijo de 7 años estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo también se dedica al mismo negocio, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Es socia de la banca hace 2 años y los créditos le han beneficiado para el incremento de artículos,  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de papel higiénico, pastas de dientes, limpiones, etc. Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Luz F. is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Estrellitas” (The Little Stars). She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known for the culture of its people and its traditions. They city has grand views to admire and enjoy. Its historical center was recognized as a World Heritage Site.

Sra. Luz has been a merchant for two years, selling personal hygiene products and seasonal merchandise. Only on Wednesdays does she sell pajamas. All of her products are sold throughout the city. She leaves to make her sales after her children have been sent to school.

Doña Luz is 30 years old, married, and has five children (ages 14, 12, 7, 4, and 2). Her two oldest daughters are in high school. The seven year old son is in elementary school. Her husband is in the same line of work. They do not own a home because they live in a rental property.

Luz has been with the Communal Bank for two years and utilized the loans to increase her inventory of merchandise. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of toilet paper, toothpaste, washcloths, and other items. Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: Purchase toilet paper, toothpaste, washcloths, and other items

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora Ana Becerrra es socia del banco comunal Las Estrellitas, vive por un hermoso sector como es Totoracocha en la ciudad de de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza cultural de su gente y sus tradiciones, cuenta con grandes paisajes para admirar y disfrutar, su centro histórico fue nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad.

Nuestra socia tiene 45 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos  de 25, 19 y 10 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive  independiente, su segundo hijo estudia,Trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su último hijo estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es fotógrafo profesional. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Ana es comerciante, se dedica a vender limpiones de cocina, actividad que la realiza hace dos años, vende su producto de domingo a domingo desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde.

Es socia de la banca comunal hace 3 años y ha llegado a tener una muy buena amistad con todas las socias de la banca comunal.  Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de limpiones para la venta. Su mayor sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ana Becerra is a member of the “Las Estrellitas” communal bank and lives in the lovely sector of Totoracocha within the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for its people’s cultural beauty and traditions.  It includes beautiful landscapes that are admired and enjoyed and has a beautiful historic downtown area that has been called “the fatherland of humanity.”

Ana is 45 years old, is in a live in relationship, and has three children, ages 25, 19, and 10.  Her oldest daughter is married and on her own.  Her next oldest son attends school, works, and helps the family financially and her youngest son attends school in town.  Her husband is a professional photographer and they live in a rented home.

Ana has been selling kitchen cleaning products for two years.  She works seven days a week from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for three years and is good friends with all of the other members.  She will use the money from this loan to invest in more cleaning products.  She dreams of having her own home.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Entrada A Chunazaca (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Entrada a Chunazan está formado por 10 mujeres quienes con su trabajo diario buscan la manera de entregar a sus familias una mejor estabilidad económica, viven a los alrededores del cantón Nabon, cantón que es de clima frió en donde la mayor parte de su gente se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales, mucha de su gente encuentran en la ciudad varios trabajos entre ellos los de la construcción, son gente humilde y mantienen su cultura.

La Señora María M. vive en la comunidad de Guantogloma que  pertenece al cantón de Nabon, tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos,  los cinco son mayores de edad y  casados, su ultimo hijo estudia en el colegio. Su esposo labora como jornalero, con el esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia. 
Doña María se dedica a trabajar como jornalera en tierras propias y ajenas donde siembra  verduras, también se dedica a la cría de cuyes, gallinas, cerdos y vacas, animales que vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. 
Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas en la banca,  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y gallinas. Su meta es llegar a tener más animales.

La Señora. Lidia C. vive en la comunidad de Guantogloma que  pertenece al cantón de Nabon. Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal. Se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos de su hogar aprovecha el tiempo para criar  cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y borregos a los cuales los vende en su comunidad. 
Doña Lidia es una mujer muy joven de 24 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 8, 6 y 4 años de edad que  estudian en una escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo labora como jornalero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa de varios herederos.
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y gallinas. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Entrada a Chuazan is comprised of 10 women who look for a way to bring more economic stability to their families through their daily work. They live in the surrounding areas of the canton of Nabon, a canton with a cold climate where the majority of people work in agriculture and raise animals. Many people find various jobs in the city such as in construction. The people are humble and maintain their culture. 
  
Señora María M. lives in the community of Guantogloma which belongs to the canton of Nabon. She is 56 years old, married and has 6 children. 5 are adults and married, her youngest child studies in high school. Her husband works as a farm laborer and with their hard work they have managed to build their own house. María works as a farm laborer on her own and others' land where she plants vegetables. She also raises guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and cows - animals which she sells when she has economic need. This is the second loan that she has asked for from the communal bank and she likes that she already has very good friends in the bank. She is going to invest her new loan in the purchase of guinea pigs and chickens. Her goal is to have more animals. 

Señora Lidia C. lives in the community of Guantogloma which belongs to the canton of Nabon. This is the second loan she has asked for from the communal bank. She is in charge of the household chores and takes advantage of her time to raise guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and sheep which she sells in her community. Lidia is a young woman of 24, married with 3 children of 8, 6, and 4 years of age who study at one of the community's schools. Her husband works as a farm laborer. They don't have their own house and for that reason they live in the house of several heirs. She is going to invest her new loan in the purchase of guinea pigs and chickens. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Ermita Conzuelo

texts.es:
La Señora. Consuelo Y. es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de sus calles, su centro histórico el que fue nombrado en diciembre de 1999 como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy amable y cordial quienes mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Nuestra socia tiene 29 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 1 hijo de dos años de edad, su esposo es comerciante de electrodomésticos, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Consuelo hace seis años se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, sale a la venta de jueves a domingo desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde, los demás días se dedica al cuidado de su hijo ya que es muy pequeño.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito y ha sido invitada por su cuñada a formar parte de la banca, ha llegado a tener una muy buena amistad con todas las socias. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir su negocio. Su sueño tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Consuelo Y. is a member or the “El Arenal” communal bank and lives in the “Feria Libre” sector of the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for the beauty of its streets and for its historic downtown center, named in 1999 as being the cultural fatherland of humanity.  Its people are very friendly and cordial and maintain their culture and traditions.

Consuelo is 29 years old, is in a live in relationship, and has a two year old son.  Her husband sells domestic appliances and they live in a rented home.

Consuelo has been selling all types of clothing for six years.  She sells from Thursday to Sunday from 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM and spends the rest of the time caring for her young son.

This will be her third loan.  Her sister in law invited her to become part of the communal bank and she’s become good friends with the rest of its members.  She will use the money from this loan to buy more clothing in order to have a variety in her business.  She dreams of owning her own home.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Jessica Tatiana

texts.es:
La Señora Jessica H. es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive en el centro de la  ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de sus calles, su centro histórico el que fue nombrado en diciembre de 1999 como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy amable y cordial quienes mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora. Jessica tiene 19 años, vive en unión libre y está muy contenta ya que tiene 8 meses de embarazo, su esposo es supervisor de un restaurante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Jessica tiene un puesto de comida rápida actividad en donde labora hace 2 años, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.

Este es su segundo crédito y fue  invitada por su hermana a formar parte de la banca comunal. Su nuevo crédito lo va  a invertir en el arreglo de su local y para la compra de frutas para realizar jugos. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Jessica H. is a member of the community bank El Arenal.  She lives in the center of the city Cuenca.  This city is known for the beauty of its streets, its historic center was named in December 1999 as a cultural heritage site.  Its people are very nice and warm, and want to maintain their culture and traditions.

Señora Jessica is 19 years old.  She lives in a common-law marriage and is very happy as she is currently 8 months pregnant.  Her husband is the manager at a restaurant, they don't have their own home, and so they live in a rental.  

Doña Jessica has a fast foot stall, where she has worked for 2 years.  She works from Monday to Saturday from 7am until 10pm at night.
This is her second loan, and she was invited by her sister to form part of the community bank.  Her new loan will go to invest in the improvement of her business site and for the purchase of fruits to make juices.  Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy fruit and improve Jessica's business location

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora Sonia V. es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la  ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de sus calles, su centro histórico el que fue nombrado en diciembre de 1999 como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy amable y cordial quienes mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora. Sonia tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 5, 4 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en la escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en donde se encarga de distribuir gaseosas, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Sonia se dedica a elaborar chuzos (carne en palito), actividad que le viene realizando hace 6 años, su producto lo vende recorriendo la ciudad de domingo a domingo sin descansar un solo día,  su horario de trabajo es de 4 de la tarde hasta las 7 de la noche.

Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y ha sido invitada por una amiga quien es socia activa de la banca. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir como capital para su negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Sonia V. is a member of the community bank Al Arenal.  She lives by the area called Feria Libre in the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for the beauty of its streets, its historic center was named in December 1999 as a cultural heritage site.  Its people are very nice and warm, and want to maintain their culture and traditions.

Señora Sonia is 24 years old.  She is married and has 3 children of 5, 4, and 2 years of age.  Her first son is studying in school.  Her husband works in a factory where his job is to distribute soft drinks.  They do not have their own home and so they rent.

Doña Sonia works making chuzos (meat on little sticks), work that she has been doing for 6 years.  She sells her product by walking around the city from Sunday to Sunday without resting one single day.  Her schedule is to work from 4 in the afternoon until 7 at night.

This is the second loan that she has taken with the community bank, and she has been invited by a friend who is an active member of the bank.  The money from her loan will be invested as working capital for her business.  Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: Working funds for Sonia's business

loans.name: Corazón De Jesús (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazón de Jesús está formado por 14 mujeres y un hombre quienes son personas muy amables y alegres, trabajadoras quienes con el esfuerzo del día a día buscan mejorar la economía de sus hogares, viven en la parroquia del Valle, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos  han  migrado a varios lugares del mundo en busca de mejores trabajos, también en la ciudad encuentran las oportunidades de un buen trabajo.

La Señora. Margarita T. vive en la comunidad de Poloma que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle. Este es  su segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, se dedica a la cría de animales como cerdos y ganado, la leche que obtiene de ellos los vende a los carros lecheros, sus animales los vende en su comunidad. 
Doña Margarita tiene 45 años, es viuda hace 14 años y tiene un hijo de 25 años de edad que es casado y vive independiente.  Vive en acompañada de una sobrina que tiene 10 años de edad que estudia en la escuela, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.  El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca. Su sueño es tener un vehículo para poder trasladarse con más facilidad.

La Señora. Ana L. vive en el centro de la parroquia del Valle, es muy joven con apenas 23 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad quienes pasan a su cuidado. Su esposo labora en una fábrica en la ciudad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 
Doña Ana pasa en casa debido a que sus hijos son pequeños pero aprovecha el tiempo para dedicarse a la cría de animales como: cuyes, pollos, conejos y patos a los mismos que los vende en su comunidad cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
Es el segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y ha sido invitada por su mamá a formar parte de la banca en donde ha formado una bonita amistad con todas las socias.  Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento, también en hierba para sus cuyes y conejos. Su meta es  comprarse un terreno.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Corazón de Jesús, is comprised of 14 women and 1 man who are pleasant, happy and hard-working people wishing to improve their home finances by their daily efforts. They live in the parish of Valle and they work in animal husbandry and agriculture. Many people have emigrated to different places in the world in search of better work, or to the city to find opportunities for a better job.  

Sra Margarita T. lives in the Poloma community which is part of the Valle parish. This is her second loan through the communal bank; she works in animal husbandry with pigs and livestock. She sells the milk obtained from these animals to the milk trucks, and sells the animals within her community.  Doña Margarita is 45 years old, she has been a widow for 14 years and has a 25-year-old son who is married and lives independently.  She lives with her 10-year-old niece who is studying at school. Owing to her work, she has managed to build her own house. She plans to invest the loan in purchasing a cow. Her dream is to have a vehicle in order to be able to move around with greater ease.

Sra Ana L. lives in the centre of the parish of Valle. She is very young, having just turned 23 years old. She is married and has 2 children, aged 4 and 2 years, who she looks after.  Her husband works in a factory in the city. They do not have a house of their own but rather they are renting. Doña Ana stays at home as her children are so young, but she makes good use of this time to work in animal husbandry, caring for animals such as: guinea pigs, chickens, rabbits and ducks, which she sells within her community whenever she has financial need to do so.  This is the second loan that she has applied for from the community bank; she was invited by her mother to join and she has established good friendships with each of the members. She plans to invest her new loan in the purchase of chickens and feed, and also in buying grass for her guinea pigs and rabbits. Her aim is to be able to buy her own land.

loans.use: To buy a cow, chickens and feed, and grass for guinea pigs and rabbits.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat lives in Gujranwala which is an industrial city in Pakistan. She lives in a two room brick house in the area named Khiyali Bypass with her family. She came there after her marriage many years ago. She has given birth to three sons who left their education incomplete and now do their own businesses. Nusrat is married to N. M., who is 50 years old and operates an onion selling business. He puts onions on a cart and visits different streets of the city to sell them. He has been doing this business for over 10 years, and people know him very well as a person who provides quality onions to them at cheap prices. 

Nusrat supports her family by doing stitching and embroidery work. She has a good number of clients in her neighborhood and she receives a good number of orders every month. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her business of stitching clothes. She will invest the loan in purchasing a new stitching machine that will help her finishing her orders on time and to work more efficiently. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes the loan will bring good profits to her by improving her business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Farah's Group

texts.en:
Farah is a talented lady and a citizen of a city named Gujranwala in Pakistan, famous for its sweetmeat. She is involved in a sewing business. She does this work to support her family to overcome their financial needs. She started this work a few years ago and is now getting good at it.  She is married to Z. who works in a private company for a reasonable income. She has given birth to a son who is very young and has not started to attend school yet. Farah wants to provide her son the best quality education in the future and this wish gives her the strength to work harder.  She always looks for new ways to improve her business to give her family relief and to enjoy the better facilities of life.  Therefore, she has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine, which will help her to do her job more efficiently and finish more orders in a less time. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: "In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands and shows a dress she has sewn is Farah".

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy things for his wedding.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan N., 58, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean Temples. N. is a vegetable seller in the city, earning an income of USD 3 per day. One of her children is employed at the factory, earning an income of about USD 1 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 55 on other necessary expenses every month. N. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more vegetable to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to stock her store

loans.name: Humaira's Group

texts.en:
Humaira is the wife of M. A.. She resides in the city of Gujranwala, Pakistan, famous for its sweetmeat. She is 31 years old. She owns & operates a decorative embroidery business at her home. She does embroidery to support her husband financially. She learned this art from her mother before marriage and now earns a profit from her skills. She gets a good number of orders every month. 

She has a two-year-old daughter whose name is Zainab. Humaira works hard to give a better future to her daughter so she will never face the same poor financial situation that Humaira faced in her childhood. She pays full attention to her daughter and raises her very well.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her business of embroidery. She will invest the loan in purchasing an embroidery machine that will help her finish her work more quickly and add more creativity to her work. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first time getting a loan from Asasah. She hopes it will bring good profits for her. 

Note: "In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands and is showing her embroidered dress is Humaira".

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine for her embroidery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena S. has been an active member of ASHI Antique South Branch since 2002. She is a resident of San Pedro, San Jose Antique, Philippines. She is married to Ruby S. who is a driver and they are blessed with four children. They are Julier who is 36 years old, Glen who is 34 years old, Zaldy who is 31 years old and Charlene who is 29 years old. Through their hardship, industry and the support of ASHI, two of their children have  finished college.

Her loans in ASHI really help them a lot because the income that they get from her business is used for their daily expenditures.

Azucena has been a member of ASHI for eight years already and, because of her good attitude, she had been elected as center chief of San Pedro Center 10 of ASHI ASB at present. As a member, she maintains her good performance, which is why she got a bigger loan. 

She aspires to have a loan from ASHI, through the partnership of KIVA, for PHP 24,000 to use as additional capital for their hog fattening and tricycle businesses.

If this request is granted, it will be a great help for them to sustain the needs of the family and to help their relatives and neighbors.

Their greatest dream is to build a decent and comfortable house with their income and to improve their business so that they will be financially stable.

loans.use: As additional capital for their tricycle and hog fattening businesses

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar does embroidery to help her husband financially. She learned this art in her teen-age years. Now she has become very skillful in her work and has obtained vast experience in her field. She is married to Z. I. and lives in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Khiali by-pass. It is located in Gujranwala, which is an industrial city in Pakistan. She came here with her family 12 years ago. Her husband works in a factory. His income is not enough to bear the financial expenses of the whole family. That’s why Kosar started her embroidery business. She has given birth to two sons. Her elder son also works in the factory on a monthly wage, while her younger son is nine years old and is studying in the 3rd class. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery materials such as colored thread, clothes, beads and sketches in bulk that will help her fulfill orders on time and generate a good income as well. Kosar remains worried about the financial future of her family, but she is hopeful that after this loan investment, her family’s financial condition will get better. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her.

Note: "In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) and shows her embroidered dress is Kosar".

loans.use: To buy embroidery material in bulk quantity

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en: Rosette is a 38-year-old woman. She is a single mother of three and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She lives in her own permanent apartment and her family's dream is to have all of her children educated. Rosette deals in the sale of clothes in the market. She actually started this business at the market roadside. She has been operating this business for the last 10 years and she wants to see it grow in the near future, though she is faced with the challenge of bad debtors and robberies in the city while shopping. Rosette intends to use the loan to purchase shirts, trousers, and shoes to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more shirts, trousers, and shoes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 38-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married with one child and lives in his own house. John has been dealing in already-made clothes, a business which he has been operating for the last 10 years. He believes that it will grow in the near future. John intends to use the loan to purchase shirts, trousers and shoes for selling in his shop.

loans.use: To purchase shirts, trousers and shoes for selling in his shop.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 49-year-old lady, married to a builder with seven children. They live in Fort Portal, Uganda. She lives in her own permanent house with a family of nine and her dream is to have a good family. Margret has been operating a retail shop for two years now and it has been steadily progressing. She says that she started with farming. This is how she got capital to start the retail shop. However, she has the challenge of insufficient funds. But this has not stopped her from seeing herself move to a wholesale shop. Margret needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for transport business as she strives to achieve her business dream of becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy a motocycle for her transport business.

loans.name: Uestline Group

texts.en:
Rhoda M. is in her mid-50s and is married with four children.  For the past nine years, she has run a shop selling soda, juice and water.  Her shop is open from 7 am to 8 pm.  She makes a fair monthly profit.
  
This will be Rhoda's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used her previous loans to buy drinks and empty crates for her shop and has successfully paid back her loans.  She would like to use her current loan to begin selling kangas (sarongs worn by Swahili women).  Her dream is to travel one day.  

Rhoda will share this loan with her group, Uestline, which has 17 members.  The group members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan. 

In the photo, Rhoda can be seen first on the left in the second row.

loans.use: To begin selling kangas

loans.name: Clovice

texts.en: Clovice is a 53-year-old man, married and very hard working. He is the head of five family members living in a self-owned permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His desire is to have a good standard of living for his family. Clovice has been into tea farming, which he ventured into after having been a businessman. He has now been in the tea plantation business for five years and, with such vast experience, he sees his business growing and being a role model plantation farmer. Clovice intends to use the loan to buy fertilizers for his tea plantation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his tea plantation.

loans.name: Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en: Halima R. is in her early 50s and is married with 10 children.  For the past 10 years, she has been quarrying.  She works from 7 am to 6 pm and makes a profit of approximately $33 per day.  This is Halima's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania and she would like to use the loan to buy more stone.  Halima is a member of the Bega Kwa Bega Group (in Kiswahili, this means standing shoulder to shoulder).  The 17 members of the group will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan.  In the photo, Halima can be seen in the middle of the first row in black and white.

loans.use: To buy more stone

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 30-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married with two children and lives in a rented house. Julius’ dream is to see his family living in his own house and says he is working so hard to achieve it, educating his children and boosting the wife’s business. He has been into the poultry business for three years and hasn’t had any hardships, which makes him feel that his business is bound to grow even more. Julius needs this loan to buy more chicks for his poultry farm so that when they mature he can sell eggs and even broilers for meat.

loans.use: To buy more chicks for his poultry farm.

loans.name: Machimbo Group

texts.en:
Asha K. is in her early 30s and is a single mother taking care of two children. Asha runs a small food stall where she sells basic groceries and charcoal. The stall is open between 6 am and 6 pm and earns Asha a low monthly profit. 


This will be Asha's fifth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Asha used her previous loans to increase her stock of goods and to improve her stall. These loans were all successfully repaid. With this loan, Asha aims to increase her business by increasing her stock of charcoal and improve the condition of the stall.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group Machimbo, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Asha can be seen third from left in the first row.

loans.use: To Increase the stock of charcoal and improve the stall.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is a married 37-year-old man blessed with four children. He lives in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda and his dream is to improve his household income for a better standard of living. Ronald is a very hard working and enterprising cattle trader who started out farming. The look on his face shows that the business is fulfilling and he hopes to see it grow in the future, though he says he is faced with the problem of insufficient funds sometimes due to high demand. Ronald needs the loan to buy more cattle to sell at a margin.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to sell at a margin.

loans.name: Tegemeo Group

texts.en:
Patrick A. is in his early 30s and is a single father of his seven-year-old son. Patrick has been running a small food store since 2008. The store is open between 6:30 am and 2:30 pm and earns Patrick a low monthly profit.

This will be Patrick's 11th loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. He used previous loans to open up the store, to increase his stock of products as well as invest in some land. Patrick has successfully repaid all these loans. Patrick aims to use this loan to increase his stock in certain goods and have extra capital at hand should one product run out. Patrick's dream is to one day be an international businessman.

Patrick will share this loan with his loan group Tegemeo, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Patrick can be seen in the back row wearing an orange T-shirt.

loans.use: To increase his stock and have additional capital

loans.name: Air Force Group

texts.en:
Jane K. is in her late 20s and is married with two children. Jane runs a small food stall where she sells several basic food products such as flour, rice and sugar. The stall has been open since 2004 and is open daily between 8 am and 7 pm. The stall earns Jane a low monthly income. 

This will be Jane's first Motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Jane aims to use this loan to improve the quality of her stall and to have more available capital should a product run out. Jane's dream is to one day open a big shop where she can sell clothes and shoes.

Jane will share this loan with her loan group Air Force, which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Jane can be seen second from right in a white blouse.

loans.use: To improve the condition of her food stall.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: Mark is a 31-year-old man who is married with two children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He lives in a rented house and his family dream is to improve his household income and educate his children as well. Mark deals in general merchandise, selling sugar, soap, cooking oil and other domestic items besides his cattle business. He has been dealing in this business for the past one and a half years. In order to help him boost the business, Mark has decided to borrow and use the loan funds to purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil and salt to sell in his shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil and salt to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Vinnie

texts.en: Vinnie is a 37-year-old single mother of three children living in a rented permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. Her family dream is to have all the children complete tertiary institutions and improve her household income. She owns a clothing shop and for six years, she has seen it grow tremendously from her initial capital of 1,500,000 shillings to 3,000,000 shillings. Although there is the challenge of limited capita, she still hopes to see it grow. Just like most parents, Vinnie is faced with the challenge of paying school fees for her children on time and thus needs credit. Vinnie needs the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Paying school fees for her children.

loans.name: Saba's Group

texts.en:
Saba lives in Chichwatni, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She lives in a 2 room brick house with her parents. She is a widow and has no children. In order to financially support her father, she sells clothes. She buys clothes from different clothing shops in the market and sells to her neighboring clients.

Her father is an herbal medicine expert. He operates his business from his home. He has been doing this business over many years. He has a good experience of diagnosing diseases and giving the right herbal medicine to his patients. She has 2 brothers. The elder brother is involved in the cotton selling business and the younger one works in a private organization for a meager income. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her elder brother. He will invest the loan in purchasing cotton in bulk quantity that will cut his cost of purchasing and allow him to fulfill larger orders on time.  He has been doing this business for the past 6 years and has good experience in this field.  Saba is hopeful that this investment will definitely help him to further improve his business.

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her brother. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Saba.

loans.use: To buy cotton for reselling

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 22-year-old man who is responsible, hard working and living in his own house in Fort Portal Uganda with a desire to have a better family standard of living. He deals in coffee purchasing for a living and he has been in the business for one year now. Julius has a dream of doing a wholesale coffee business. The purpose of the loan is to enable Julius buy more coffee seeds for selling at a margin.

loans.use: Buying more coffee seeds for selling at a margin.

loans.name: Nazareth Group

texts.en:
Shaibu K. is in his early fifties and is married with five children. One year ago, he opened his own grocery store. The store is open daily between 9 a.m. and 10 p.m. and earns Shaibu a low monthly profit. 

This will be Shaibu's second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his first loan to buy a large stock of soap and introduced this product to his store. This loan has been successfully repaid. With his second loan, Shaibu aims to once again expand his business, this time by introducing beer, soda and water to the products offered at the store. Shaibu hopes to one day be eligible for an individual loan with Tujijenge. 

Shaibu will share this loan with his loan group Nazareth, which totals 20 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.
 
In the picture Shaibu can be seen in the back row, 1st on the left, wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: Increase stock of beer, soda and water.

loans.name: Peluce

texts.en: Peluce is a 23-year-old lady who is married with one child. She lives in her own permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. Her dream is to have a God-fearing family and also have sustainable income for the family. Peluce has been dealing in agriculture farming for six years and has seen noteworthy changes in her investments. For example, she has been able to buy land and enlarge her house amidst the challenge of fluctuating prices and weather changes. Peluce needs the loan to buy chicks for her poultry farm in order to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy chicks for her poultry farm business.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a 38-year-old man who is married with three children. He lives in his own family house in Fort Portal Uganda and his family dream is to have his children educated. He deals with metal fabric, which has enabled him to maintain a minimal standard of living. However, William has the challenge of limited capital and this has affected his household income. William needs the loan to purchase an angle line to ease his metal fabrication business work.

loans.use: To purchase an angle line to ease his metal fabrication business work.

loans.name: Paul Njoroge

texts.en:
Paul K. is 45 years old, married to Margaret and they have eight children: the eldest is 28 years old and the youngest 11 years old. They live in the Isbania area on the outskirts of Migori town.

Paul has a clothing business that he has been running for the past three years and he has seen his business grow through the years. He is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd. after successfully paying the previous one without any difficulty. He will use the money to buy more clothes to add to his stock as he has orders from his clients.

His desire is to expand into a wholesale shop one day where other business people would be able to buy stock from him to sell.

loans.use: Buy clothes to add to his business

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.en:
Juma R. is in his mid-twenties and married with one daughter.  He has run a food shop for the past four years.  In his shop he sells flour, sugar, wheat, etc.  The shop is open daily from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m.  This will be Juma's tenth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used his past loans to open the shop and to pay interest on the shop.  Juma plans to use this loan to increase the capital of his business.  

Juma is a member of Riziki Group, which has 15 members.  The members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan.  In the photo, Juma can be seen seated in the second row, wearing a black shirt and black cap.

loans.use: To increase the business' capital.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 34-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He owns a permanent house and lives with seven family members. His family dream is to improve his household income. Peter is a motorcycle rider and has been in the business for 10 years now. He says his business dream is to have his own motorcycle. His challenges are irregular customers and fluctuating fuel prices. He needs this loan to buy his own motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Munkhsaikhan

texts.en:
Munkhsaikhan is 32 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  They live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son attends a local secondary school and his wife looks after their youngest daughter at home.

He has been operating an on-call carpet cleaning service business since 2008 with his 3 employees. During these years he has gained a lot of experience. In the future, he is planning to build a wooden house in his family’s yard.

This is Munkhsaikhan’s second loan through Credit Mongol. With this loan he will purchase a vacuum cleaner and other cleaning equipment.

loans.use: To purchase a vacuum cleaner and other cleaning equipment.

loans.name: Doviko

texts.en: Doviko is a 72-year-old married man with five children. He also looks after other dependants and lives in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a dream of seeing his children attain higher levels of learning. Doviko is a very enterprising man who started from a meek background selling a few pigs and graduated to weekly trading of at least eight pigs. Doviko intends to use the loan to buy cement for construction of his house for rentals.

loans.use: To buy cement for construction of his house for rentals.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie T. is from Santiago St., San Jose, Antique, Philippines. She is 46 years old, married to Alberto T. and they are blessed with 3 Children.

Marjorie is a mother who dream fora bright future for their children. Her eldest child is already 22 years old and a graduate of Marine Engineering. The second child is a first year college student, while the youngest is in fourth year high school. She is very thankful to ASHI and its partner because one of her childing is already working as a seaman.

Marjorie is also one of the oldest and active members of ASHI ASB. Through her diligence in business, she earns an income which can sustain the basic needs of the family and educational allowance of her child who is presently taking a specialized course. She believes that, one way of getting out of poverty is through education. That is why she does everything as she can in order to send her children in school with which they will earn a degree and achieve  their dreams.

She wishes to apply for her next loan of  Php.40, 000.00.  This amount will purchase some farm supplies and provide additional capital for hog fattening business. This loan will be a great help in meeting the needs of her family, especially the educational allowance of her children.

She wants to put up a piggery project so that they will become financially stable someday. Her greatest dream is that through the help of ASHI and KIVA, all of her children will finished their studies in college.

loans.use: Hog Fattening and Farming

loans.name: Chhouk

texts.en: Mrs. Chhouk R., 32, sells various kinds of vegetables in Battabang Province, and earns approximately $3 profit a day. She has a life partner in her husband (pictured here) who works in the construction field. This couple has three children. Two of them are single and study in public school, and the remaining one is a worker. Mrs. Chhouk R. works at construction every day. Mrs. Chhouk R. said that it is a good chance for her to expand her business but her saving account is adequate to make it possible.  Therefore, Mrs. Chhouk R. would like to request a loan from Kiva in order to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is the resident of Chichawatni which is located in Punjab province of Pakistan and famous for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a 2 room brick house with her family in the area named Bilal gunj where she moved many years ago. She is a housewife and spends most of her time at home doing her household responsibilities. But recently, she has started an embroidery business at her home to supplement the income of her family. 

She finds time by managing the household responsibilities on time which allows the required time to do her work. She has started receiving orders from her neighboring customers and tries to fulfill them on time, receives regular orders and in generating good income as well. 

Her husband, M. H., has a business of selling plastic baskets. He sells the baskets to customers and earns income for the family. Sughran has given birth to 2 sons. Both are young and work in an auto work shop as a motor mechanics earning small incomes. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her business of embroidery. She will invest the loan in purchasing an embroider machine that will help her making embroidered clothes in less time and fulfill the order on time.  She is hopeful that this loan investment will bring her better income. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and attended every meeting. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran”.

loans.use: To buy an embroidering machine for  an embroidery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda J. is from the village of Tabid, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Eda is married and has five Adult-age children. To make a living, Eda owns and operates business a mini-grocery store. Eda has been engaged in her business for over 1year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Eda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eda has successfully repaid a loan of 10,000 PHP. Eda is now requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional grocery stocks. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

 About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stocks.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy M., from the village of Rizal Avenue, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, is 49 years old, married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Daisy owns and operates a direct-selling business. Engaged in her business for over 13 years, she earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Daisy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 45,000 PHP, she is now requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase an additional stock of goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase addititional stock

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina G., from the Barangay of Gotocan Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, is 53 years old, widowed and has three grown children. To make a living, Felomina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Felomina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felomina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used for the acquisition of coco land. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For acquisition of coco land

loans.name: Rofel

texts.en:
Rofel D., from the barangay of P-1 Embargo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, is 38 years old, married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Rofel owns and operates a motorcab for hire. Engaged in his business for over eight years, he earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Rofel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 20,000 PHP, he is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase a brand new motor. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information

loans.use: To purchase a brand new motor

loans.name: Ma. Georgen

texts.en:
Ma. Georgen F., from the village of Tigbao, is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Georgen owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling specialty food products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ma. Georgen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale, she is requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 14000 PHP to be used for the same purpose. Ma. Georgen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Moeun K., age 31, sells used clothes at the busy local market in the province of Battambang. From that she is able to earn about $5 a day to support her family. She has been married for many years to Mr. Loerk Sarat, 37, a motor taxi driver, and they have four children, all of whom are single and still living under their roof. 

Recently Mrs. Moeun K. sold nearly all her inventory to her buyers and she wants to replenish her stock, but she lacks capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan in order to purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Enecita

texts.en:
Enecita B. lives in the village of Puerta, Lurugan, Valencia City. She is 52 years old, separated and has two grown children. She makes a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells items people need daily such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snacks. She has run her store for more than 14 years and earns about 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2009, Enecita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid four previous loans from HSPFI and has applied for a new one to buy additional items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa C. is from the village of Trigos, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Elsa is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. Elsa has been engaged in her business for one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Elsa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Elsa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad K. is a 53 year-old farmer who breeds sheep and cows in the region of Agsu. He is married and has four children. He started his business in 2005 and since that time he is doing very well serving meat to the local people. Meat is very popular among Azerbaijani people as they use it in everyday cuisine. This business generates his main income, but he also has a small grocery store. He already took a loan from KIVA through AqroInvest and successfully repaid it. Now he applied for a 1000 AZN loan to purchase more cattle and sheep.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep and one cow

Venancia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP that will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Venancia from HSPFI. loans.name: Azar

texts.ru:
Azar V. 37 let. Om jenat i imeyet 3 detey, doch kotoroy 9 let ona uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya tancami, doch kotoroy 7 let ona uchitsya toje v shkole i sin kotoromu 1 qod. Azar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste s semyoy. 

Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Azara on ochen blaqodaren lenderam za pervuyu ssudu. S pomoshyu pervoy ssudi on razvil svoy bizness i uvelichil svoy budjet i poetomu reshil otkril sebe magazin. On uje 1 qod kak otril magazin. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo dyadyi. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye.
texts.en:
Azar Valiev is 37 years old. He is married and has three children. His daughter is nine years old and she goes to school and takes dancing lessons. Another daughter is seven and she is also in school and his son is one years old. Azar is an internally displaced person and has been relocated from Fuzuli and now lives in the region of Absheron together with his family.

This is a second loan for Azan and he is very grateful for the first one. With the help of the first loan he expanded his business and increased his budget which enabled him to open his store. It has been one year since he opened the store. He has learned his business from his uncle. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to expand the store.

loans.use: To expand the store

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida, age 40 (pictured holding the book, known as an Asasah Passbook), engages in stitching work at her home to supplement the income of her family. She is very skillful in her work and therefore receives regular orders every month. She and her husband have four sons and a daughter. The three older sons left their education due to financial constraints and began working at an early age in order to financially support the family. The eldest son is a vendor of fruit salad. The second-eldest son sells a kind of Punjabi food called Samosay, which is very popular among the local people. Sajida's third son sells cold drinks such as Coca Cola. Her two younger children are very young and are presently getting their education. 
    
Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son's fruit salad selling business. He will invest the loan in purchasing seasonal fruits in bulk quantities, which will enable him to make fruit salad in good quantity to sell to his customers. He has been engaged in this business for over five years, and Sajida is confident that with the loan investment her son will successfully be able to expand his business and increase his income. 

Sajida lives in Chichawatni, a small city in the Punjab province known for its agriculture and dairy industry in Pakistan. She resides in a two-room brick house with her family. She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits in bulk quantity for fruit salad selling business

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en: Altantuya D. is 27 years old single mother of an infant baby. She lives with her daughter in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Altantuya operates a retail food business. She cooks the food in her home and delivers it all over town to markets and office buildings. She started her business in 2005 operating a ger cafe in Uyanga soum and since 2009, she has been running her mobile meal trading business. After years of operation, she has established a loyal customer following because of her delicious, quality meals. For the future, she hopes to have her own cafe. She has recently graduated from vocational training as a pastry cook and plans to buy the necessary equipment and tools in order to expand her business. Her earnings have enabled her to build a winter house in her yard. Altantuya is a very modest, optimistic and hardworking woman. She is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan so that she can purchase new equipment to make bread and pastries.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Sherpine

texts.en:
Sherpine A. is 33 years old from Migori town and married to Samson. They have three children and two orphans that they are taking care of.

Sherpine runs a food stall that sells fruits and vegetables. She is in need of money to be able to buy more fruit and vegetables to add to her stock and has applied for a loan to enable her do this. This is the third loan she will be accessing from Kadet Ltd and she has a good credit history with us. Her business has really improved since she took out the previous loans. The profits made will be used to cater to her family's needs and also the orphans that she is taking care of.

Her hope and dream is to see all her children through school.

loans.use: Buy fruit and vegetables to add to her stock

loans.name: Abizeranye Group

texts.fr: Joël Ndagimana est un membre du groupe Abizeranye, et il vend les montures de lunettes et les téléphones portables.  Il a 36 ans, marie, et il a 5 enfants entre 3 ans et 13 ans.  Quatre de ses enfants vont à l'école.  Avec son prêt, il veut acheter une machine à couper les vitres des lunettes, une machine à nettoyer les vitres des lunettes, et les montures a verres des lunettes.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l'affaire est d'accroitre son business en achetant les matériels plus compétent, acheter de grands machines a nettoyer a grande capacités, acheter beaucoup de montures des lunettes classiques, et louer un endroit ou il y a un espace suffisant pour accueille beaucoup de clients. Il a quelques visions pour son business, comme élever le stock de ses produits, avoir des machines suffisants et d’une bonne compétence, et avoir un comptoir pour son commerce.  Ses ambitions pour sa famille sont d'améliorer leur bien-être, une bonne alimentation, et d'avoir un bon logement pour eux.
texts.en: Joël Ndagimana is a member of the Abizeranye group and he sells spectacle frames and mobile telephones. He is 36 years old, married and has five children between the ages of three and thirteen years old. Four of his children go to school. With his loan he wants to buy a machine for cutting spectacle lenses, a machine for cleaning spectacle lenses, and glass spectacle frames. His strategy for expanding his business is to buy better quality equipment, as well as large machines for large-scale cleaning, to buy a large amount of classic spectacle frames and to rent a place with sufficient space to cater for a large number of customers. He has several ambitions for his business, such as increasing his stock, having sufficient good quality machines, as well as having a counter for his sales. His personal ambition is to improve his family's well-being and to provide them with good food and housing.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for cutting spectacle lenses

loans.name: Shamaddin

texts.en: Shamaddin A. is 52 and has sold men clothing for the last four years. He is married and has two sons. He works in the Agsu region and buys clothes in Baku city, two hours away. He was able to increase his income owing to a KIVA loan which he has already successfully repaid. Now he has applied for 1000 AZN to purchase new seasonal clothes to increase his profit.

loans.use: purchase new seasonal clothes to increase profit

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes F. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao. She is 54 years old, married and has one adult  child. To make a living, Lourdes owns a business making and selling food. She has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC which was used as business capital and is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to redeem pawned land. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Lourdes from PMPC. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem her pawned land

loans.name: Gwendolyn

texts.en:
Gwendolyn A. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old and married and with six adult children. To make a living, Gwendolyn owns a retail store selling fish such as milk fish, mackerel, and sardines. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Gwendolyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Gwendolyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: working capital to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Anhbayar

texts.en:
Anhbayar B., age 27, trades in raw materials, such as sheepskin and wool, at his trading business in his town. He lives with his wife and daughter in a fenced house in the Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. Anhbayar purchases his materials from sources in the countryside, collecting them with his own truck and selling the materials in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, for a profit. 

He started his business in 2004, by purchasing a raw materials in the local market and selling those materials to wholesalers. After years of successful operation, he has managed to expand his business. With his earnings, he was able to afford to buy a new truck in order to transport his materials. 

Anhbayar has gained a lot of experience and knowledge over the years and he hopes to use this experience and knowledge to keep his business growing. His future goals are to continue growing his business and to provide a good education for his child. 

He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more raw materials from the countryside and rural areas in order to increase sales.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials duch as sheepskin and wool to offer for sale

loans.name: Nadia

texts.ar:
ناديا عمرها 40 سنة ارملة ولديها ولدان لديها محل لبيع الالبسة طموحا تحب عائلتها                                       
واولادها وتريد لهم الحياة الجيدة من خلال تأمين جميع متطلباتهم المعيشية                                                     
تحب عملها وتسعى الى تطوير نفسها وعملها محبوبة من جميع محيطيها                                                          وزبائنها لديها معاملة جيدة مع الزبائن                                                                             
تهدف من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة وتوسيع محلها
texts.en: Nadia is a 40-year-old widow with two children. She owns a boutique to sell clothes. She is ambitious, loves her family and her children, and wants to to give them a good life by providing all their needs. She loves her work and seeks to develop herself and her business. Her customers and those who know her all love her, she treats her customers well and aims with this loan request to buy new goods and expand her boutique.

loans.use: Purchase of a new vehicle for the business

loans.name: Koim

texts.en: Koim S., 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean Temples. S. is employed at a factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker in the city, earning an income of about USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 33 on other necessary expenses every month.
