S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. is not available.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mrs. Yim C. (shown in the photo) has been married since 1976 and has five daughters. Two of them are married and live in separate homes, one is a garment factory worker, one is in a local school and another one weaves silk at home and assists her mother in the business. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Yim raises pigs at home and her husband produces rice wine. Yim is requesting a loan of US $600 to continue her business by purchasing feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To use for raising pigs.

loans.name: Joash

texts.en:
Joash O. is 45 years old. He is from Migori town. He is married and has four children who are all boys between the ages of 18 years and 9 years old.

Joash has a business of sugarcane that he has been doing for the past eight years. He is applying for his second loan from KADET  LTD  to enable him to buy more sugarcane for crushing. Sugarcane does well in his location and his business has really improved since the first loan. The profits made from this business will be used to cater for the family's needs.

His desire is to be able to buy an electric cane crusher and be able to stop using the manual one.

loans.use: To buy more sugarcane to add to his stock

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov U. (pictured above) and her husband, Bey Pich, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have five children: three sons and two daughters. One of them is a garment factory worker, two attend school and the other two are security guards. 

Pov is a weaver. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver. She has asked for a Kiva loan several times already. Now she is applying for another loan of $1,000 to purchase weaving materials for continuing her weaving business and to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials and to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites S., age 47, is a fish vendor. She sells fish and rice. Marites has been a member in very good standing of ASHI Antique South Branch since 1999. She is also one of the trusted members of the branch who is approved to obtain a bigger loan.

Marites and her husband, William S., have three children: Marwill, age 26, Willmar, age 22, and William, age 20. The youngest is still engaged in his studies. Marites's husband is employed as a government employee. While they both earn an income, Marites is concerned about challenges in her own business, specifically because there are times when she has a smaller income due to fluctuations in capital and the availability of supplies of fish. Despite these challenges, she maintains a 100% credit rating in ASHI because she wants to achieve greater working capital and, above all, she wants to prove that poor individuals such as herself have dignity and are worthy of trust.

For her next loan she is requesting Php 47,000, to be utilized as additional capital for her fish vending and rice retail business.

Her greatest dreams in life are for her youngest to finish his studies and for the resources to build and reside in a decent house, through the help of ASHI and Kiva. She aspires toward becoming financially stable so that they can also help their neighbors and relatives.

loans.use: To be utilized as additional capital for her fish vending and rice retail business

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mrs. Lang S. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Nat Chum, live on an island located 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1970 and have eight children: three sons and five daughters. Four of them are married and live outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker, one weaves silk at home, one assist his parents in the business and another one is in school.

Lang and her husband sell fruit (mangoes). They buy mangoes from their fellow villagers under contract. This means that they pay money before the harvesting season and then they collect mangoes to sell at Phnom Penh market. 

Lang has asked for a Kiva loan several times already. She hopes to continue increasing the number of mangoes she buys and sells, so she is applying for another loan of $500 to purchase mangoes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes under contract for resale.

loans.name: Buuveibaatar

texts.en:
Buuveibaatar A. is a 23 year old young man who lives with his father and siblings in Tosontsengel province, Mongolia. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Buuveibaatar is the oldest son in the family and is responsible for providing for his family. He is a jeweler while his brother operates a shoe repair shop in their town. 

He has a lot of skill as a craftsman and designs and produces a variety of jewelry and accessories. He started his business with the help of his father in 2006 and has gained significant experience. Since then, he has worked hard to grow his crafts business, and he currently rents a workplace with his brother. His other sibling is a university student but has stopped attending the university because Buuveibaatar could not afford his sibling's tuition fee. Buuveibaatar plans to work hard and expand his business so that he can collect money to pay his sibling's tuition fee next year. 

He says, " I have many dreams such as expanding my business, having my own work place, and buying a new car. Some of those dreams are in the process of coming true in the real lif.e"  He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase casts and more white silver for his jewelry products making business.

loans.use: To purchase casts and more white silver.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata J. is 40 years old. She is from the Siaya district and is married to Jacob J.. They have four children who are all above 18 years old and in college.

Consolata has a business selling second hand towels and curtains. She has been doing this business for the past five years and has created a huge clientele. She wants to buy two bales of curtains to add to her stock and has applied for a loan of Kshs 70,000 from KADET LTD. Her monthly income is Kshs 15,000, which is her profit and is basically being used to pay college fees for her children.

Her desire is to be able to open up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy two bales of second-hand curtains to add to her stock

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married man with two school-age children. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a jewelry designer since 1992. He started working in this occupation when he was young and he learned it from his father. He works independently from his home in his business. He offers different types of designs from multiple catalogs to his clients. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional gold plate as a raw material to make more designs and attract more clients. He hopes that with the help of the loan he will increase his business capital and be able to open a jewelry shop in his town in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional gold plate as a raw material

loans.name: Phirum

texts.en:
Phirum C. and his wife, Sokha Kong, are vegetable farmers. They grow cucumbers and green beans. The couple has requested, received, and repaid two Kiva loans, and now Phirum is requesting another loan in the amount of $500 to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farming business.
  
Phirum C. and Sokha Kong were married in 1994. They have three sons and one daughter. The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for farming

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou J. is from the village of Malagana, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Marilou is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, biscuits & junk food in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Mang

texts.en:
This is Mr. Mang Y., age 44, and his wife, Mrs. Srey Phat, age 41. They have been married since 1990 and have two sons and three daughters. One is a garment factory worker, one is a construction worker, and the other three are in school. Mang has been a construction worker for eight years. His wife is a stay-at-home mother. 

They presently reside with Mang's mother, but they would like to live in their own home. This is why Mang is asking for his first loan of $500, which he will use to build a house.

loans.use: To build a house in which to live

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena L., from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Orienta, is 49 years old, married and has four grown children. To make a living, Elena owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling snacks such as rice cakes and cassava cakes in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale, she is now requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients and use as working capital. This will be Elena's sixth loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As working capital and to purchase additional ingredients

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mr. Phally S., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Saroeun Born, 39, have been married since 1989 and have six children. The family lives along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Phally and his wife, both farmers, grow cauliflower, green beans and bitter gourds but do not have enough capital to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their farm. Phally is therefore requesting a loan of $1,200 to make these purchases.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James K., age 40, has a transport business and he owns a motorbike that he uses to transport his clients. He has been in this business for the past five years and has created a sizeable clientele. He and his wife, Milliecent Anchieng, have four daughters and two sons between the ages of four and 16 years old. The family lives in the town of Migori.

James wants to buy a new motorbike, the purchase of which will create an employment opportunity for one person, and he needs to do maintanance on the old motorbike. For these reasons, James has applied for a loan of Kshs 80,000 from KADET Ltd. This will be his second loan.
 
He aspires toward buying a Nissan minibus in the future to help grow his transport business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike and to perform maintenace on an existing motorbike

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores V., a married woman who lives in Purok Bool, Brgy. Cartagena, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental, earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a fishing enterprise. Her husband, Danilo V., 36, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children ranging in age from nine months to eight years.

Dolores joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is requesting PHP 29,500, with which she intends to buy a new pump boat and stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Dolores V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a community member who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Melanio

texts.en:
Melanio E., age 36, buys and sells bananas and coconuts in his local store. Melanio has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. He is unmarried and resides in the village of Igpit, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. 
  
In 2008, Melanio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. He hoped to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Melanio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional coconuts and bananas to buy and sell. Melanio is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and employed as working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Melanio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and employ as working capital

loans.name: Yehya

texts.ar:
يحيى عمره 55 سنة يعمل في تجارة الالبسة من اكثر من 15 سنة متزوج ولديه                                                 
ولدان يحب عائلته كثيرا ويسعى جاهدا الى تطوير مصلحته وزيادة بضائعه                                                    
ويساعد ايضا زوجته في الخياطة له سمعة جيدة جدا في محيطه محبوب لديه ثقة بعمله وتطويره                                     
يسعى من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء ماكنة خياطة جديدة وبضائع                                                    
لتطوير مهنته زبائنه من محيطه وجيرانه مقصود بعمله يحب تحسين وضعه                                                        
المادي والاجتماعي وتعليم اولاده بمستوى جيد
texts.en: Yehya, 55, is married with two sons. He has worked in clothing retail for 15 years. Yehya loves his family very much and he works hard to develop his business and increase his stock. He also helps his wife in sewing and enjoys a very good reputation in the neighbourhood. He is an amicable character who trusts his ability to work and develop his business. Yehya wishes to get a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a new sewing machine and more goods to promote his business. His clients are mainly in his neighbourhood. He wishes to improve his social and financial conditions and provide his children with a quality education.

loans.use: to buy goods and sewing machine

loans.name: Byambadorj

texts.en:
Byambadorj G. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a house inside a fence in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His older son, age 10, attends a local secondary school while his younger son is in kindergarten and his wife works as a salesperson in a company. 

Byambadorj operates a transportation business. Using his own truck, he manages a coal, firewood and timber trading business in his town. He purchases his materials from the countryside and brings them back to the capital of the province for resale. He began his business in 2000, and since then, he has gained much experience as a truck driver. He says, “I am planning to buy a larger, fuel-efficient truck with a hauling capacity of 5-10 tons”. 

Byambadorj is requesting a 2,100,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more coal and wood at wholesale prices from mining operations and the countryside to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more coal and wood

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa S. is a 67-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating  threembusiness ventures:  Piggery, Rice Grinding and Furniture Sales businesses.She lives in Humayan, Brgy. Cartagena, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for 7 years now and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her Piggery, Rice Grinding and Furniture Sales businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,500. Ninfa is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she  can  fund her business operations.   This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. 

Ninfa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operation of her piggery

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla V. is from the village of Bolisong, Kinuguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Perla is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Perla owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from dealing and selling clothing, shoes, lotions & other AVON products in the local community. Perla has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Perla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Perla is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Perla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Chingerel

texts.en:
Chingerel B. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a traditional housing tent called a 'ger', in Uvurhangai province, central Mongolia. Her husband is disabled and her oldest child, a son, is a university student and her younger children, two daughters, both attend a local secondary school. 

Chingerel started her own business in 1997 selling a variety of foodstuffs and since 2001, has been operating dairy products and milk trade in a rented stall at Zanabazar market in the province. During the summertime she sells fermented mare's milk. After many years of operation, she has become very experienced in her dairy products trade. 

Chingerel says, " I hope to continue operating my business as a sustainable operation. For the future, I plan to expand my business and establish my own small dairy product factory." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products and consumer goods at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products and consumer goods

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina E. is a rice vendor, buying and selling rice at both the wholesale and retail level. Her husband, Raymundo E., age 44, works as a rice mill Operator to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 14 and 17 years old. The family lives in Sitio Cantonog, Brgy. Linao, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental

Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired toward something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gina has been working hard and incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourteenth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stocks to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and meet her family needs. 

Gina E. is truly a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Dungganon is a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable." Through this alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities they could not even have dreamed of. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of rice to offer for sale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old married woman and has three children of whom one is still attending school. She is from Lebanon. She established a tailoring business out of her home in 1980. She produces different types of clothes, pants, shirts, robes etc. and she distributes them to some locA. traders. 

In addition, she makes clothes to suit the requests of the clients. Today, she is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase tailoring supplies and textiles and to perform maintenance on her sewing machine. These modifications will help her deliver her services faster. In the future, she is planning to open a small tailoring factory. Her services are valued by customers in some of Lebanon’s suburban towns.

loans.use: purchase tailoring supplies and textiles and perform maintenance on her sewing machine

loans.name: Enhbaatar

texts.en:
Enhbaatar R. is 25 years old and lives with his wife and three-year-old daughter in Tosontsengel province, Mongolia.  He and his family live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. His wife is a nurse but currently unemployed and so she helps with Enhbaatar's business while he works as a carpenter in their town. He has owned his carpentry business since 2007, after living in the countryside as a herder till 2006. 

Within the short time he has earned the loyalty of his customers because of the quality of his work and service. At first, he started to produce small wooden products such as tables, chairs and boxes, etc., and since 2008, has been making and selling a range of furnishings in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and through the "Ger Initiative" project of ADRA International Non-Government Organization. 

He produces not only a variety of furnishings but also a small souvenirs such as dolls, toy vehicles and carriages to sell through the ADRA organization. After years of successful operation, his earnings have enabled him to purchase a plot of land and a fence. Moreover, he was able to start building a new house that will be used as both a workplace and living accommodation. 

Enhbaatar says, " I will have soon my own house and now I plan to buy a new car that will enable me to operate a taxi service and transport my own products." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan  to purchase a new car in order to start a taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a new car to use as a taxi and to transport his products

loans.name: Ma. Rochel

texts.en:
Ma. Rochel D. P. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Republic, Brgy. 4, Roxas, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  sari-sari (general) store and tricycle (public transport) operator businesses. Her husband Allan D. P., who is 26 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living. They have 2 children who are 3 and 6 years old. 

Ma. Rochel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Rochel has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 27,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and to purchase a parcel of land. 

Ma. Rochel D. P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob K. is a 21-year-old man married to Lydia Cheruiyot who does horticulture farming with him. They have one children a year old, so Jacob supports a family of two. Jacob does horticultural farming in Kapterik near Tambach trading centre in Keiyo district.

He has been in this business for the last two years and he gets an average profit of Kshs 15,000 per month. He has taken out a loan of kshs 49,750, this being his second loan, after successfuly repaying the first loan. He intends  to use the loan to purchase pipes for irrigation, fertilizers, and pay for plowing the land and pay labour.

Jacob anticipates using the profits from the business to expand it and also to pay back the loan. He hopes and dreams of providing adequately for his family and saving for future education costs.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs e.g., pipes for irrigation, buy fertilizers, pay for plowing and labour

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is a 56-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:   farming, rice retailer and food vending businesses. She lives in Catlagan, Bgry. Daan Banwa, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.

 By working hard at her farming, rice retailing and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,000. Elizabeth is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase a transport vehicle.  This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Elizabeth aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of transport vehicle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.ar:
عباس عمره 26 سنة غير متزوج صاحب محل لبيع العصير لديه خبرة واسعة في صنع العصائر والمشروبات يحب عمله ويريد ان يتطور
ويؤمن مستقبل جيد له ولعائلته له اكثر من 3 سنوات في عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة ان يشتري ماكينات جديدة لمصلحته  
لكي يطور محله له زبائن كثر خاصة في نطاق منطقته ورفاقه واقاربه يلقى دعم مستمر من عائلته لكي يتتطور
texts.en: Abbas is 26 years old.  He is married.  He is the owner of a juice shop and has extensive experience in producing juice and drink recipes.  Abbas loves his job and is looking to develop and secure a better future for himself and his family.  He has been in the profession for more than three years.  Abbas wants to use his loan from Al Majmoua to purchase new equipment for his business.  He has a wide clientele base within his region, which includes his friends and relatives.  He receives ongoing support from his family which helps him develop.

loans.use: To buy new machines to expand the shop.

loans.name: Margaret Wambui

texts.en:
Margaret Wambui N. has operated her retail shop in Naivasha town since 2006. She is 22 years old and a single mother of two children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She paid all her previous loans on time.  She plans to use the loan amount of 50,000 KES to buy sugar, rice and flour in bulk which she will later sell in small quantites to her customers.

In the future, Margaret hopes to grow her shop to be a mini supermarket.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour and rice in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas, age 32, sells clothes for a living. He has been engaged in this work for three years and his monthly income from the business is Kshs. 6,000. He is requesting a loan of Kshs 30,000 from KADET Ltd. and will use the loan to purchase more clothes to offer for sale during the coming festive season. With the anticipated profit from the business, he hopes to open another business. 

This is his second loan and his previous loan was successfuly repaid. His dreams are to have a stable business and to assist the needy in the society.

Douglas and his wife, Jacklyne B., who also produces some income, do not have children, but together they support another family of six people.

loans.use: To expand his clothing sales business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita L. is a married woman who lives in Brgy, Talubangi, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: Tricycle Operator, Networking and Buy & Selling Dried Fish / Charcoal businesses.  Her husband Ramon L., who is 50 years old, works as a Tricycle Driver to earn his living.  They have 3 children who are 20 to 24 years old.  

Lolita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lolita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus raising the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 20th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital/maintenance so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children.  Lolita L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance and additional capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The purchase of more spare parts for resale

loans.name: Ochir

texts.en:
Ochir B. is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two-year-old son in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. They and his mother live together in their own apartment. Ochir owns and operates a pet shop in his house. He sells a variety of animals through his shop and has found a success with his business. He makes a fish aquariums and animal cages for his pet shop. His business is very popular because it is only business of that type in the province and therefore attracts many customers. 

To supplement his income, he also works as an agent of MCS Company in Uvurhangai province. For the future, his dream is to educate his child at a good university. Ochir is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase fish and glass for his pet shop.

loans.use: To purchase fish and glass

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Loani Ole Tayaka

texts.en:
Loani has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town since early this year.  He finds the business profitable.  He is 63 years old, married to Naitoi Wetaka, and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the cash to buy three calves and five sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In future, Loani hopes to grow his income generation so that he can be able to send his children to a good school.

loans.use: To buy three  calves and five  sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 52-year-old married man and has five children who are still attending school. He is from Lebanon. He makes his living as an experienced driver; he has been working with his van taxi for over 20 years. His main route is between his town and its surrounding areas. And he also takes private transportation requests. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to perform much needed maintenance on his van taxi, including changing the tires and repairing the engine. His business income is vital to support the heavy expenses of his big family.

loans.use: to perform much needed maintenance on his van taxi, including changing the tires and repairing the engine

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia Nyangweth is 48 years old from Kisumu city. Her husband, Michael, is currently unemployed and she is left with the sole responsibility of taking care of the family. They have eight children who are all in college.

Patricia has a second hand clothes business that she has been running for the past 25 years. Her monthly income comes to 30,000 KES. She is currently applying for her second loan as she is in dire need of purchasing more bales of second hand clothes to add to her stock. The profits made from this business go to the upkeep of the family.

Her desire is to be able to open up a boutique shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy two bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg R. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Tosontsengel province, Mongolia. She and her family have been living in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent and fence, for the past 18 years. One of her children attends university and another child studies at the local school. Her husband works as a loader in the meat-processing factory. Oyunchimeg currently operates a small bakery in her town. 

In 2004, she started her bakery business at first making only breads to sell in her home. Today she produces between 20 and 25 types of breads and baked pastries. Her child helps in her business. After years of successful operation, she has managed to expand her business and purchased a new oven for her bakery production. Her earnings have enabled her not only to provide for her family, but also to pay her son's tuition fee. Over the last few years, she was able to improve her family's standard of living by purchasing carpets, a TV set, a ger's cover, etc. 

She is a hard-working woman who is focused on the future growth of her business. She says, “ I have a plan to expand my business and to create a more efficient workplace in the future”. Oyunchimeg is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase and maintain a large amount of flour and supplies for her bakery production.

loans.use: To purchase flour and bakery supplies

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita T. is a 63-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: pig fattening and farming (sugarcane and corn). She lives in Ulalod, Bgry. Orinago, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig fattening and farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 9,000 PHP. 

Lucita is now borrowing 18,000 PHP so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her last loan of 14,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Lucita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Funds for business operation

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kanyerere Ii Kyamwasha Bakyara Basheija Group

texts.en: N. Aidah, age 50, belongs to Kanyerere II Kyamwasha Bakyara Basheija Group - Ntungamo. She has been at the helm of her tailoring business for 18 years, before which she worked as a farmer. Aida is a widow with four children. Being a widow has not in any way dampened her determination as she has continuously worked hard to provide for her family without the support of her husband. She tells us that in order to get established in this business, she had to get apprentice training from a tailoring school first. Prior to that, her mind was fully focused on farming. Her tailoring business generates 30,000 shillings weekly. With this loan she says she is going to buy more pieces of fabric with which to to sew more clothes to offer for sale.

loans.use: To buy more pieces of fabric with which to to sew more clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy A. is a member of ASHI who never stop dreaming despite the difficulties and challenges in life. She is 38 years old from Comon, San Jose, Antique Philippines.  She is married to Palagio A. Sr. and they are blessed with four children. Her eldest child is 13 years old while the youngest is 2 years old and three of their children are still studying in school.

She earns her living through manicure and pedicure while her husband is a laborer. 

After the delivery of her youngest child, she has had difficulty earning a living because she can’t leave her newly born child, so her income has been affected. Despite the challenges encountered, she never gives up. She is trying her best to earn a living and to pay her loan to ASHI because she doesn't want her good performance to be ruined.

Since the income/work of her husband is unstable, they plan to buy a tricycle and they need PHP 40,000.00 to start the project. This project is very helpful to them because if her husband does not have work, he can drive their tricycle so they have a stable income.

She wishes to have all of their children finish their studies through college so that they will never experience the hardship brought on by poverty. She also dreams that through their industry and courage they will reach their dreams.

Lastly, she is very thankful to our almighty for giving her strength to face the challenges of life and she is also inspired by ASHI and its field Partners (KIVA) since they are always there, willing to support them to reach their dreams and aspirations.

loans.use: Buy a Tricycle.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen J. is 33 years old and from the Chemisoi area in the outskirts of Kisumu city. She is married to Sammy Too, and they have six children who are all over 18 years old.

Hellen has a business selling baked scones, locally known as "mandazi," which are a delicacy here. They are mostly used for taking tea. Hellen is applying for her fourth loan from KADET LTD and has a good credit history with us. She is in need of baking flour, cooking oil, and baking powder, which is her reason for applying for this loan. Her profits will be used to buy household items and educate her children. 

Her desire is to start another business alongside the current one.

loans.use: To buy baking flour, cooking oil, and baking powder to add to her stock

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou N. is a married woman who lives in Bgry. Daan Banwa, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a canteen and a peanut-butter business. Her husband, Rolando N., who is 34 years old, works as a government employee to earn his living. They have two children who are 6 and 9 years old and are currently going to school. 

Marilou joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired after something better for her family. With the help of her past eleven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marilou has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her twelfth loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her peanut-butter business so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Marilou N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en: Tsetsgee D. is 50 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son currently works and lives in Korea, her middle son works as a private businessman, and her two younger children both attend a local high school. Her husband is a carpenter and produces a variety of wood products in his town. Tsetsgee operates a business selling children's toys with the help of her sister. She began her business in 2000 and has gained significant experience and many permanent customers as well. She sells a variety of children's toys that are imported from China. Tsetsgee's dream is to continue growing and expanding her business and to save money for her children's future educational costs. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT in order to import a large amount of  children's toys from China to sell.

loans.use: To import a large amount of children's toys

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel M. is a twenty eight year old shoe seller in Kongowea Mombasa.  He is married to Ann Waithaka who is a business woman.  Together they are blessed with three children.

Samuel has been in this business for the last seven years and he is doing well with a good income. As a member of KADET he is requesting his second loan of 40,000 KES to purchase more shoes for resale.  He plans on using the anticipated profit to open up another shoe store in another part of Mombasa town.  He hopes to grow his business into a shoe importing firm in the future and see his family succeed in life.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for resale

loans.name: Tuul

texts.en: Tuul B. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two-year-old son in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son and husband stay at home. Tuul started her own business in 2004 selling cellphone parts in the local market. Since 2009, Tuul has been operating a clothing retail trading business out of a rented stall at the local market in her town. In addition to her clothing business, she started a bakery production in her home to supplement her earnings. Tuul hopes to continue expanding her business in the near future. She says, "My wish is to have my own shop." She is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan for her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more clothing items

loans.name: Kihanga Women's Group

texts.en: G. Bosco is 35 years old and he belongs to the Kihanga Women’s Group. He has been operating his alcohol and food sales businesses in Nyakibale cell in Ntungamo for 12 years. He says he learned from a close friend how to effectively run a business. Bosco is married with 4 children and in a week his business profits average 50,000 UGX. With this loan he plans to purchase more crates of both hard and soft drinks for resale at his small pub.

loans.use: to purchase crates of soft and hard drinks for resale at his pub

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said Kivuona is a 25-year-old milk supplier in Likoni, Mombasa. He is married to Mesaid Juma and together they are blessed with two children. Kivuona has been in this business for the last year and his income has been great. He is now requesting his second loan from KADET LTD to purchase more milk to stock. He will use the anticipated profit to reinvest in the business. He hopes to grow his business, be successful in life and be in good financial position for a better living standard for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more milk to stock

loans.name: Batchinges

texts.en: Batchinges D. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in an apartment in Tosontsengel province, Mongolia. His wife works as a nurse in the hospital. Batchinges used to work and live in Korea from 2007 to 2009. He started his own business by operating a variety of small businesses such as raw material trading, consumer selling, etc. after returning from Korea. Batchinges currently operates a karaoke and vegetarian cafe. He has been engaged in this business since April, 2010 and has not yet built a stable operation. Even though his business has not found success, he is happy with it since it is very helpful for people's health. Someday, he will provide training to people and explain how important it is to eat nutritional food for health. Batchinges hopes to establish a good business in the community. He is a modest man and says, " When my mother got sick, I started to think about operating a vegetarian cafe. I think that it is very important to have healthy foods; therefore, I really want to help people learn the benefits of nutritional foods."  He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase a new large LCD TV set for his restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase a new large LCD TV

loans.name: Vafa

texts.ru:
Vafa H. 33 qoda. Ona ne zamujem i jivet vmeste s semyoy. Vafa yavlyayetsya IDP personom , ona pereselenec iz Agdam, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione.

Vafa uje 5 let kak otrkila svoy salon. Ranshe ona rabotala pomoshniccey v salone svoyey teti. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye. U neyo mnoqo kliyentov i poetomu ona xochet uvelichiv pomesheniye chtobi tam ona moqla vzat na rabotu yeshe odnu rabochiyu chtob uspevat so vsemi kliyentami.
texts.en:
Vafa H. is 33 years old. She is not married and lives with her family. Vafa is an internally displaced person and has been relocated from Agdam and now lives in the region of Absheron.

It has been five years since Vafa has opened her beauty salon. She used to work as an assistant in her aunt's beauty salon. At this time she needs 2000 AZN to increase the area of the salon. She has many customers and this is why she wants to expand so that she can hire one more employee to attend to all her customers.

loans.use: To expand the salon area

loans.name: Jaquline

texts.en: Jaquline M. is a 31-year-old M-Pesa (a mobile-phone based money transfer service) business owner in Changamwe, Mombasa. She is a single mother of one who has successfully been in this business for the last two years. She is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD to open another M-Pesa outlet and will use the anticipated profit to increase her float. She hopes to develop her business wisely in future.

loans.use: to open another M-Pesa

loans.name: Altansuvd

texts.en:
Altansuvd D., age 39, operates a retail food business. She cooks the food in the family’s "ger" (the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in which the family lives) and delivers it all over town to markets and office buildings. She started her business earlier this year based on her experience working in a cafe as an assistant worker. She tells us, "All I want is to provide a good education for my three children." 

She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to buy food supplies for her business and to pay her children's tuition fees of 250,000 MNT.
 
Altansuvd lives with her husband and three children, ages 12, 17, and 20, in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. During the winter months, she and her family live in a "ger," and during the summer months, they live in a government house. Her husband works as a road repairer.

loans.use: To buy food supplies for her business and to pay her children's tuition fees

loans.name: Azzaya

texts.en: Azzaya G. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. He and his family all live together in their ger /Mongolian nomadic housing tent/ and fence. Both his two sons attend secondary school and his wife operates a meat trading business after running a small cafe in the local market. Azzaya owns his own car and is a taxi driver in his town. He began his business in 2007 and has gained a lot of business experience in a short amount of time. He needs to keep his car in good condition so that he can continue to earn a living. Therefore, Azzaya is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to upgrade his car that is used as a taxi.

loans.use: To upgrade a car

loans.name: François

texts.fr: François N., il est salarié, et il était soldat.  Il a 50 ans, veuf, et il a 2 enfants entre 20 ans et 22 ans.  Tous ses enfants vont à l'école.  Avec son prêt, il veut acheter du ciment, des portes, des tôles, des fenêtres, et des sables pour sa maison.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l'affaire est une épargne excessive pour terminer les actions faites sur maison, et une bonne gestion de ce prêt. François voudrait avoir une habitation bien aménagée, et aider les enfants à terminer ses études.  Ses ambitions pour sa famille est d'éduquer les enfants avec une éducation solide.
texts.en: François N. is an employee and was a soldier in the past. He is 50 years old, a widower, and he has two children aged 20 and 22 years old. Both his children are studying. With his loan, he wants to buy cement, sheet metal, windows and sand for his house. His strategy is to amass an excess of savings to finish work on his house, and to manage his loan well. François would like to have a well equipped house and help his children to finish their studies. His ambition for his family is to give his children a solid education.

loans.use: Purchase of cement, doors, sheet metal, windows and sand

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom O. is 30 years old. He operates both a water kiosk and a barber shop business in Mikindani Mombasa.
Tom is married and he and his wife are blessed with one child.The wife manages the water kiosk.
Tom has been in this business for the last three years. He was introduced to KADET by a group member and he is now requesting  his first loan to increase his capital in order to supply water to offices and to use the anticipated profit to open up a stationery shop.
He hopes that in future he will be able to keep his family well and have an established business which provides for all the family needs.

loans.use: To increase his capital in order to supply water to offices.

loans.name: Nyabubare Women's Group-Ntungamo

texts.en: Constance T. is 46 years old, married and has 6 children. For the past 15 years she has been selling agricultural products in Bibunye-Ruhara-Ntungamo.  She has mostly been selling bananas, beans and milk. With 400,000 shillings as her monthly profit, it is fair to say her business has been growing steadily. With this loan Constance plans to buy a cow. Constance belongs to the Nyabubare Women's group-Ntungamo.

loans.use: The purchase of a cow.

loans.name: Amgalan

texts.en: Amgalan C.  is 46 years old and lives with her four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia in an apartment. Her oldest daughter is helping with Amgalan's business after graduating from university. Her two children both attend university and her youngest daughter studies at the local high school. She used to work as a teacher in several schools after graduating from university as a drafting teacher in 1983. Amgalan currently operates a souvenir products trading business in a rented stall in the local trade center. She started the business in 2005 and has built a stable and successful operation. She sells a variety of handmade products such as bags, rings, belts and bracelets that she produces. After years of owing this business, she has gained many skills as a craftswoman. She is requesting a 3,700,000 MNT loan to purchase a computer and its parts in order to prepare drawings that are used in school drafting classes.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and its parts

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is a 47-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is into poultry. He has been operating this business for the last 10 years. He also started from a meek background, having 100 chicks and graduated to trading at least 500 chicks. He says that although he is faced with the challenge of plague in the poultry business, he has hopes of becoming a big commercial poultry farmer and role model. Johnson intends to use the credit facility to buy layers and broilers for his poultry farm.

loans.use: To buy layers and broilers for his poultry farm.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Ganbaatar L. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Dornogobi province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent in his parents' yard. Two of his sons attend a local secondary school. Ganbaatar owns his own iron/metal work business where he produces such items as stoves, stove pipes, doors, truck trailers, carriage chairs for motorcycles, smokestacks and mesh wire etc,.according to his customers' orders. He began his business in 1996 and has built a stable operation with many customers. After years of successful operation, he has gained a wide customer base. His business earnings have enabled him to provide for  his family and to buy new electronic equipment such as a music player and a TV set. Currently his parents live in a different province therefore he plans to buy the house and fence where his family lives  from his parents. For the future, he also plans to build a new work place for his steel production. Ganbaatar is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan in order to purchase the following material and equipment such as a power saw at 150,000 MNT, 3 metal plates at 300,000 MNT, 10 iron sheets  at 200,000 MNT and supplies like glue, paint, nails and sandpaper etc, for his metal goods making business.

loans.use: To purchase material and equipment for his metal goods business.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy is a 44-year-old, married mother of four living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a permanent house and her dreams are to have a better family standard of living in the future and to see her children attain higher levels of education. Teddy deals in bicycles, spare parts, bar and lodge. She started small as a teacher, which actually led her to where she is now. However, she has the challenge of unreliable shop attendants and unpredictable price fluctuations, which seem to affect her dream of becoming a stable business lady in the future. Teddy intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more inventory

loans.name: Ochirbat

texts.en: Ochirbat S. is 54 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest son attends university and his youngest son attends the local high school. Ochirbat currently operates a felt craft business in his town and his family members have helped his production. In 1996, he started to make handicrafts and has built a stable operation. At first, he made and sold shoes and boots; he currently designs and produces a variety of felt products. His earnings have enabled him to pay his son's tuition fees. His younger son will start to attend university by next year. Ochirbat is a modest and hardworking man. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more supplies and felt for his crafts business.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies and felt

loans.name: Rwahi Womens Group-Ntungamo

texts.en: K. Kate, 47 years old, has belonged to the Rwahi Women's group for the past 26 years, relying on her agro produce sales business as a source of livelihood.  Year in, year out, she has brought hard work, conviction and determination to bear. She sells her foods at a food stall in the Rwahi trading center, which she claims is the reason she has stayed in business this long. She has mostly been selling beans, peas, sorghum and maize, which are staple foods in Uganda. She continues to farm. In a week, her profits total up to 100,000 UGX. With this loan, she plans to buy onions to plant and resell upon harvesting.

loans.use: to purchase onions to plant and resell after harvesting

loans.name: Chirine

texts.ar:
شيرين في عمر ال 25 سنة تعمل في مجال السكرتيريا وهي اكبر اخوتها غير متزوجة                                                 
 تحب عائلتها واخوتها كثيرا تساعد اثنان من اخوتها طموحة وتحب التجدد في العمل والانتاج                                     
تسعى الى تحسين وضها الاجتماعي وهي تطلب قرض من المجموعة بهدف  تعليم الأخ الاصغر منها                                       
وهو يحلم بأن يصبح طيار وايضا تعليم الاخت الاصغر ,                                                                    ودفع قسطها المدرسي شيرين تلقى دعم كبير من محيطها فهي محبوبة  من جميع افراد عائلتها ومحيطها العملي
texts.en: Chirine is a 25-year-old single woman who, in her work as a secretary, strives to always be dynamic and productive. She receives considerable support from her family members and co-workers, and in turn very much loves her family and siblings, of whom she is the eldest. In order to help two of her siblings achieve their dreams, Chirine is asking for a loan from Al-Majmoua to help with the tuition of her younger brother who aspires to become an aviator as well as of her younger sister.

loans.use: Education of younger brother and sister.

loans.name: Khamis

texts.en: Khamis K. is a 32-year-old "boda boda" (motorbike) operator in Changamwe, Mombasa. He is married to Brenda, who supports his income. K. has been in this business for the last four years and has done great. With this second loan from KADET, he would like to add to his cash in hand and purchase another motorbike. He will use the anticipated profit to purchase a third motorbike. In the future, he would like to own a tuk tuk (tri-cycle).

loans.use: add to his savings and purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Richard Kibet

texts.en:
Richard Kibet K., age 29, operates an Agrovet shop in the Njipiship market centre. He has been running this shop for the past year and has seen his business grow. He wants the business to grow further and has applied for a loan from KADET Ltd. This will be his first loan. He wants to buy veterinary medicines to add to his stock, since most of his clients are farmers. 

Richard supports his wife, Tegla K., with the income from his business. They do not yet have children. They live in Olechobose near the Njipiship market centre in Kilgoris Town. 
  
His desire for the future is to be able to open another Agrovet shop in Dikir center in Kiridon division.

loans.use: To buy veterinary medicine to add to his stock

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.ar: مصطفى في عمر 43 سنة متزوج وعنده  ولدان يحب اولاده وعائلته كثيرا يعمل بجد ونشاط  لديه باص لنقل الطلاب  له في عمله ما يقارب 13 سنة يحب عمله ويسعى الى تطوير نفسه وتأمين كل احتياجات عائلته يريد من خلال اخذ قرض من المجموعة الى شراء فان جديد لتوسيع مصلحته  مستواه التعليمي متوسط لذلك يريد ان يحسن وضعه المادي والاجتماعي ومساعدة اولاده على استكمال تعليمهم زبائنه هم من جيرانه واصدقائه طموح وجدي جدا بعمله وملتزم من حيث تاريخه السابق مع  المجموعة.

loans.use: Wants to buy a new van for the expansion of interest

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther G., age 35, sells a variety of different items in her general store. She is requesting a loan in order to stock more bags of sugar, boxes, soap, and other items to offer for sale. Her husband is an NGO staff member. They have eight children, all of whom attend school. 

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to serve as a residence for the family.

loans.use: To stock more bags of sugar, boxes, soap, and other items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Samson Oreu

texts.en:
Samson Oreu K., age 36, is a maize farmer. He cultivates this crop because the area is known for producing good, fertile maize. He and his wife Evaline live in Osupuko village in Kilgoris Town with their four children: Naserian, age 13, Ledama, age 11, Napamei, age nine, and Lanei, age seven.

Samson has just harvested his crops, so he is in need of more maize seeds to plant. He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by a friend who is a client here. The profits made will be used to cater to the family needs.

His desire is to see his business grow and be able to employ people to help him run the business.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds for planting in the next season

loans.name: Itojo Bakyara Tutungukye Group-Ntungamo

texts.en: Juliet M., a 43-year-old member of Itojo Bakyara Tutungukye group - Ntungamo, has been operating her retail shop for 20 years. She says constant diligence, determination and courage have greatly contributed to the success of her operations.  A happily married mother of nine children, Juliet established her shop using savings from her earlier business selling bananas, and now earns a weekly profit of shillings 80,000. She will use this loan to purchase more retail items such as sugar, bread, salt and plastics for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail items such as sugar, bread, salt, etc. for resale

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora K., age 30, is a charcoal vendor. She sells her wares at the local market. She is requesting a loan in order to stock bags of charcoal to offer for sale. Flora and her husband, who has his own business, have six children, all of whom attend school. 

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes eventually to be able to buy a piece of land and build a house for the family.

loans.use: To stock bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina J. is married to Kenneth Koech and they have eight children, all students below 18 years old. They live in Chemusoi area in the town of Kisumu where Regina has been running a cereals business for the past three years. With a good credit history she is applying for her fourth loan from KADET LTD in order to buy more maize to add to her stock.

Her family depends on her totally for upkeep and she is working very hard to ensure that there is food on the table each day. Her desire is to be able to raise the living standard of her family by ensuring that her business grows and her profits increase.

loans.use: To buy maize to add to her stock

loans.name: Young Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Young” group. These are small-scale farmers/entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 700,000 each in order to invest in their businesses/farms. 

John K. is the leader of this group. John is a 39-year-old married man with three children who are attending primary school. John sells market food such as rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), and nut oil (lesser in value to palm oil). He has been a businessman for six years now. He will use his share of this loan to buy the above-mentioned goods in larger quantities to add to his current stock. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy rice, palm oil, and nut oil in larger quantities to add to his current stock

loans.name: Keji

texts.en: Keji M. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of groundnuts to make paste to sell. Keji is 35 years old and married; her husband also works. She has 7 children who all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to stock more bags of groundnuts to make paste to sell

loans.name: Evans Makas

texts.en:
Evans Makas is 33 years old and married to Betty Cherono, a pre-school teacher who also supports him in his business and with basic needs for their family. They have been blessed with two children: Kieth, 7 years old, and Staisy, 4 years old. Evans runs a hotel business at Kampi ya Moto trading centre in the town of Koibatek; he started this business three years ago. Evans has borrowed 20,000 KES for his second loan, having successfully repaid his first one.
  
Evans plans to use the loan to purchase stock for his hotel, such as cooking fat, sugar, salt, beans, rice, wheat flour, tomatoes, onions, potatoes and other items. Evans anticipates using the profits from the business to expand it. In the future, he would like to buy a plot of land to build residential houses. He dreams of owning a residential estate in the future and also giving the best education to his children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for the hotel

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret D. is currently in the business of selling various items in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice, sugar and beans. Margret is 28 years old and married; her husband works in the government. She has 3 children who do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: to stock more bags of rice, sugar and beans to sell

loans.name: Nyakabungo Traders Group

texts.en: M. Jonan, a steadfast and courteous 28-year-old, has belonged to the Nyakabungo Traders group for the last 12 years. It is a group that, on the face of it, operates as a cohesive unit and M. Jonan has been one of the movers and shakers in it all this while. He began his current banana sales business with savings from his former chicken sales business. Jonan is happily married with 2 children. His weekly profits amount to 50,000 UGX. He plans to use this loan to purchase more bananas for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas for resale

loans.name: Agnes Akinyi

texts.en:
Agnes Akinyi O., 42 years old, is from Kilgoris town and is married to George O.. They have four children: Fanis - 18 years old, Janet - 16 years old, Belinda - 14 years old and Lavenda - 12 years old.

Agnes has been selling secondhand clothes for the past 10 years. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD to be able to buy five bales of clothes to add to her stock. Her business is situated in the market and has thus attracted a huge clientele through the years. All her children attend school so the business profits will provide for their school fees.

Agnes' desire is to expand her business and be able to earn more income in order to pay school fees comfortably for her children and raise her famly's living standards.

loans.use: to buy five bales of clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky L. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread products like legemat (sweet fried dough balls) and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour to use to bake more products to sell. Vicky is 30 years old and married. Her husband is an NGO staff member. She has no children yet.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more baking flour in order to bake more bread to sell

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac O. is 29 years old, from Obunga in Kisumu city. He is married to Maureen, and they have three children: five-year-old Evans, three-year-old David and two-week-old Raphael.

Isaac is a carpenter by profession and has been in this business for the past five years. He is currently applying for his second loan from Kadet Ltd, to enable him get some timber and nails to add to his carpentry shop. He earns an income of 8,000 KES.

His main desire is to have a big carpentry shop and be able to cater to his family's needs and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy nails and timber

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret J. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock fish to sell. She is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a government staff member. She has no children yet. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: To stock fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 52-year-old married man and the father of three children. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as an experienced constructor from the past 20 years. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his family needs. His wife plays a major role in helping him with the household. Today, he is requesting a $1,200 loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. for a new big project he is planning to lead. He wants to be prepared for this new project and accomplish it successfully, and to build a good business reputation with the new construction entrepreneur he is working with in order to take more projects in the future.

loans.use: For a new big project being planned

loans.name: Hadia

texts.en: Hadia J. is currently in the business of selling fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more fish. Hadia is 25 years old and married. Her husband is a business man. She has four children, two of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more fish

loans.name: Wilson Kipnyagan

texts.en:
Wilson K. is 38 years old and married to Sarah Ronoh. They have been blessed with seven children aged between 3 and 17 years. Sarah supports him with an income of 1,500 KES per month. Wilson runs a butcher shop that he started a year ago. This business gives him an income of 2,000 KES a month. 

For his first loan, Wilson is borrowing 10,000 KES. He intends to use all the money to buy animals for slaughter. He anticipates using his profits to increase the number of animals for slaughter and open a retail shop. Wilson hopes to expand his business and give his children the best education.

loans.use: To purchase animals for slaughter

loans.name: Keji

texts.en: Keji M. is currently in the business of selling beans and tomatoes and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans and rice to sell. Keji is 28 years old and is widowed. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a car for hire.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase painting supplies

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora S. is currently in the business of selling beer at the bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Flora is 23 years old and single.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Umaro

texts.en: This is 36-year-old Umaro. He is married and has two children aged 8 and 5. He has two additional dependents who are family members and attend school.  Umaro has a men's wear business. He began his business to become more self-reliant. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,632,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Umaro requires a new loan in order to buy shoes, jean trousers and t-shirts. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 244,800.
