In the future, Umaro plans to change his life and build a house, to expand his shop and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy men's wear

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther J. is currently in the business of selling beer and local brew at her bar in Jebel kujur,Juba, South Sudan and is requesting a loan of 600 SDG to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Esther is 25 years old and is married to a husband that is a peasant. She has 2 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret J. is 48 years old and a food kiosk owner in Magongo Mombasa.  She is married to Patrick Makoko and they are blessed with three children.
Margaret has been in this business for the last three years and has a good income. 

This is her second loan from KADET she would like to use the loan of 50,000 KES to carry out renovations to her kiosk and to purchase more food stuff to stock her kiosk. She will then use the anticipated profit to expand her business.  In the future she hopes to open up a restaurant

loans.use: To carry out renovations to her kiosk and purchase more food stuff to stock her kiosk.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children. For the past few years, he has made his living as a professional driver. He operates a van service for customers in his village as well as neighboring towns. He has been in this field since 2001. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to perform maintenance work on his van. He reports that these improvements will enable him to provide his service to more passengers. He hopes that his business will be better in the coming year. In the future, he is planning to buy another van taxi and operate two vans services to earn more income for his family.

loans.use: To perform maintenance work on his van.

loans.name: Mathew Sentero

texts.en:
Mathew Sentero P. has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He is 30 years old, married to Nailatei Ene Sentero and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount of 50,000 KES to buy 10 calves and 8 goats which he will rear and sell at maturity.

In the future, Mathew hopes to own a big animal farm and supply the Kenya Meat Commision with beef in bulk.

loans.use: To buy 10 calves and 8 goats which he will rear and sell at maturity.

loans.name: Itezimbere Mugore W'urwanda Group

texts.fr: Marine N., est une femme de 38 ans, et elle est un membre de la groupe Itezimbere Mugore W’urwanda, un groupe des femmes entrepreneurs.  Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique à Bugesera.   Elle est mariée, et elle a 6 enfants entre 2 ans et 15 ans.  Trois de ses enfants vont à l'école.  Avec son prêt, elle veut acheter de poisson, de l’huile, et des haricots.  Marine voudrait acheter une vache, et une maison d’habitation.  Son ambition pour sa famille est le paiement de frais scolaire pour ses enfants.
texts.en: Marine N. is a 38 year-old woman, and a member of the Itezimbere Mugore W’urwanda group of female entrepreneurs. She owns a shop in Bugesera.  She is married with 6 children between 2 and 15 years old, three of whom attend school.  She would use her loan in order to purchase fish, oil and beans. Marine would like to buy a cow and a place to live. Her main aim is to be able to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase of fish, oil and beans

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: S. Fred is Kayunga based and he has been in a boda boda or a commercial motorcycle business for the past 3 years in Kangulumula-Kayunga. With earnings from this business he has supported his family fairly well in terms of better welfare. He also has a beauty salon business. At 38 years old, Fred is single but with 5 kids. With this loan money of 2,500,000 UGX he says he is going to buy another boda boda or motorcycle to expand on his operations.

loans.use: The purchase of another  motorcycle as a means of expanding his business.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa S. is 27 years old and he is the head in a family of five people (including himself).  He is married and his spouse does not contribute to the family’s total income.  He has two children aged four and two years.  


Musa runs a hotel where he sells cooked foods and snacks to customers who are within his business location. He has been in business for two years and he earns a monthly income of Kshs. 5,000. He has just borrowed a loan of Kshs. 20,000 to purchase more hotel stock which included the charcoal for cooking, the vegetables and flour which is needed to prepare the food he sells and others. He will use the anticipated profit from the business to open another hotel. This is his second loan and his previous loan was successfully paid back. 


His hopes to open a retail shop in future.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna J. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to stock more bread, cakes, etc to sell.  Anna is 28 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase land for her family.

loans.use: Stock more bread, cakes, etc to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly S. is a 48-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: a ready-to-wear clothes business and a welding shop business. 

She lives in Brgy. Bulwang, Mabinay, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her ready-to-wear clothes and welding shop businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 15000.  

Nelly is now borrowing PHP 19500 so that she can purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Nelly aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina N. is a married woman who lives in Purok Santan, Brgy. Pandan, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures:   Buying and Selling of Rice, Pig Fattening, and a General Store business.  

Her husband Florencio, who is 63 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living.  They have three children who are 21 to 26 years old. 

Magdalina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Magdalina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,200, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 21st cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to buy more stocks of rice to sell so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children. 

Magdalina N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Hiam

texts.ar:
هيام في عمر ال 47 متزوجة ولديها ولد تعمل في مجال الاشغال اليدوية تحب عائلتها وابنها وهي محبوبة جدا بمحيطها تلقى دعم كبير من عائلتها                                                                                                       
حيث بداءت هذه المهنة منذ اكثر من 7 سنوات طموحة ولديها ذوق كبير في مجال عملها لكن ما ينقصها هو المال لكي تطور مهنتها    هيام تريد قرض من المجموعة بهدف شراء بضاعة جديدة لتوسيع العمل, تريد ان تبدأ بتزيين حفلات                                الأعراس
texts.en: Hiam, 47, is married with a boy. She works in handicrafts. Hiam loves her family and son and is known in her neighbourhood for having a very amiable character. She enjoys huge support from her family. Hiam started her business more than 7 years ago. She is ambitious and has excellent taste in her work but she lacks the capital needed to develop her business. Hiam applied for a loan from Al Majmoua to buy new goods to expand her business. She wishes to start working in decorating wedding areas.

loans.use: to buy goods and expand her business

She has 1 child and her child do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

loans.use: Stock more brewing materials like yeasts, sugar etc

Mary is 40 years old and is married with a husband that is a peasant.  She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for her children.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with two children all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and electricity bills.

She makes natural juices for sale to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells fresh water from home contributing to her other source of income. Beatrice faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in her area of operation. She hopes to establish rental house in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a fridge compressor to repair her fridge of storing natural juices which she makes for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation from the community.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge compressor to repair her fridge of storing natural juices which she makes for sale.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean B. is a married woman who lives in Purok Kan-asam, Brgy. San Miguel, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating two (2) business ventures:  Fish Vending and Jeepney transport.  Her husband Pablo B., who is 45 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are 13 to 22 years old. Mary Jean joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mary Jean has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her fish vending so that she can continue to save for the future education of her children. Mary Jean B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose P. is currently in the business of selling various food items such as cassava and maize flour. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food items to sell, including maize flour and beans. Rose is 35 years old and is married to her husband who is a business man. She has five children and only one child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase land.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell, including maize flour and beans

loans.name: Mwanamwinyi

texts.en:
Mwanamwinyi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but does not have piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a business selling kikois (colored cloth used for clothing), handbags, ornaments and purses for over two years. Mwanamwinyi sells door to door predominately to women and to her neighboring community. She faces the challenge of high transportation costs while selling door to door. She hopes to open a boutique and become self reliant in the future. 

Mwanamwinyi  decided to join Yehu to get loans in order to boost her business. With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings she hopes to purchase kikois, ornaments, handbags and purses for resale.

loans.use: To purchase kikois (colored cloth used for clothing), ornaments, handbags and purses for resale.

loans.name: Meliza

texts.en:
Meliza B. is a married woman who lives in Proper Budlasan, Canlaon City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   a general store, motorcycle transport and videoke singing. Her husband Pasto B. Jr., who is 40 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have five children who are 13 to 21 years old. Meliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Meliza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000, which she intends to use to buy stocks of goods for her general store so that she can continue to save for the future expansion of her business and the education of her children. Meliza B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase materials, sewing threads and clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

Flora is 47 years old and is widowed.   She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land for her family.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

She has operated a charcoal-selling business for over two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Halima faces the major challenge of competition from other charcoal operators. She hopes to open a retail shop in the future.

Lucy decided to join Yehu to get financial support to boost her business. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Wadad

texts.ar:
وداد عمرها 30 سنة متزوجة ولها ولدان تحب عائلتها كثيرا وتريد لها وضع اجتماعي جيد  تعتمد على نفسها فهي تعمل منذ اكثر من 5 سنوات                                                                                                           
طموحة تتطور في عملها فهي لديها محل لبيع الاكسسوار والعطور تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة زيادة البضاعة الموجودة     وزيادة الانواع في محلها بعد نقصانها                                                                                   
زبائنها يحبونها وهم من محيطها وجيرانها تجيد عملها بشكل جيد تعاني صعوبة في السيولة لتطوير العمل تتلقى دعم كبير من عائلتها  وزوجها بعد ان اعتمدت على نفسها في العمل
texts.en: Wadad, 30, is married with two sons. She loves her family very much and wishes to secure a good social status for them. Wadad has been self-employed for more than five years. She is an ambitious character who is developing her business. Wedad has a shop for selling accessories and perfumes. She wishes to get a loan from Al Majmoua to increase her current stock and to buy out-of-stock items. She is loved by her clients from her neighbours and her circle. She is good at work but lacks the capital needed to develop her business. She has enjoyed strong support from her family and husband after she started working on her own.

loans.use: To purchase stock and develop business

loans.name: Neli Ernesto

texts.pt:
Neli Ernesto Z. nasceu no Distrito de Chokwe, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique casada e mãe de 9 filhos 4 dos quais já casados e 5 ainda a freqüentar Escola. Não teve oportunidade de estudar porque era órfão. Vive na casa de aluguer com alguns dos seus filhos e sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Chokwe para Maputo depois de seu casamento. Tem um negócio próprio de criação e venda de frangos de corte ha mais de 6 anos, conta com ajuda do seu marido que também desenvolve a mesma atividade. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua vizinha que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos, raçoes e vacinas para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro credito para aumentar a sua criação e melhorar o seu aviário.
texts.en:
Neli Ernesto Z. was born in Chokwe District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique.  She is married and has nine children, four of them married and five who still go to school.  Neli had no opportunity to study because she was an orphan.  She lives in a rented house with some of her children and supports two grandchildren who live with her.

She left Chokwe to move to Maputo after she married.  For more than six years she has had her own business raising and selling broiler chickens.  Neli relies on the help of her husband, who works in the same business.  She earns about 4,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses.  She also manages to save some money in her bank account.

She has never had loans from other banks.  Neli learned about Hluvuku through her neighbor, who is also a customer of this institution.  This is her first loan.  She is asking for 10,000 meticais to buy chicks, feed and vaccines so she can increase her stock of chickens.

Neli is confident that she will pay ahead of time and ask for another loan to increase her quantity of livestock and improve her chicken coop.

loans.use: Buy chicks, feed and vaccines

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a married woman with five children, all of whom graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity bills. 

For over twelve years, she has operated a cereal shop business, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. Flora faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and purchase a taxi (motor vehicle) in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase ten bags of maize and beans for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase maize and beans for resale.

She has three children who are 16 to 20 years old. Procy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and house rent bills.

She has operated a charcoal and coconut selling business for over five years, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. Mwanatumu faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting charcoal from the forest to the urban areas for resale. She hopes to expand and purchase a tuktuk (three-wheel taxi) in the future.

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase fifteen bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 27 years old, a single mother supporting her four children, her three siblings, and her mum. 

She has a good history with KADET LTD and is applying for her third loan from KADET.  She plans to use the amount to purchase cereals as follows:   48,000 KES to buy maize, 30,000 KES to buy beans and 2,000 KES to buy green grains.  She has been in this business for nine years and earns a monthly income of 27,000 KES.  

She will use the anticipated profit from the expansion to open another business of selling car fuel, for which she has already gotten the fuel pump. 

Her dreams and hopes is to put up a campsite as part of her business empire within her locality, and to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more grains for resale.

texts.fr:
Séraphine M. est une femme de 31 ans, et elle est un membre de la groupe Abunzubumwe KGRM, un groupe des femmes entrepreneurs.  Elle vend les fruits à Nyabugogo.   Elle est mariée, et elle a 3 enfants entre 5 ans et 10 ans.  Tous ses enfants vont à l'école.  Avec son prêt, elle veut acheter des fruits.  Séraphine voudrait améliorer ses activités, alors elle pouvait vendre les fruits au marché a Nyabugogo.  Son ambition pour sa famille est de rénover sa maison d’habitation.

Note**  Il y a sept personnes dans ce groupe, mais il y a huit personnes dans la photo.  Une de ces femmes était enceinte, alors elle ne travaille pas encore.
texts.en:
Séraphine M., 31 years old, is a member of Abunzubumwe KGRM, a group of women entrepreneurs. 

She sells fruit in Nyabugogo. She is married and has three children between the ages of five and ten. All attend school. 

Séraphine plans to use her loan to buy fruit. In order to boost her operations, she could sell the fruit at the Nyabugogo market. Her goal is to renovate the family home.

Note ** There are eight people in the photo, but this group consists of seven members. One of the ladies was pregnant and is not currently active within the group.

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta E. is a 50-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  a small eatery and a piggery business.

She lives in C. Batiancila, Poblacion, Sta. Fe, Cebu.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her small eatery and piggery businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000. 

Loreta is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she could fund her business operations. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. 

Loreta aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). 

Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Funds for business operations

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine A. is a married woman who lives in Madinumdumon, Brgy. Utod, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store.  Her husband, Joygen A., who is 29 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living.  They have two children who are 3 to 6 years old. Cristine joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cristine has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to buy stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future improvement of her business and the education of her children. Cristine A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old married woman from Lebanon. A mother of two young children, she has established a mobile phone shop in addition to selling computer accessories and games. 

She has been involved in this occupation since 2005. As is common among Lebanese women, she helps her husband with the family expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her merchandise selection and  to purchase prepaid telephone cards from a wholesaler at a good price.   The majority of mobile phone users in Lebanon purchase these prepaid cards -- it is less common to have an annual phone contract. 

In the future, she is looking to further expand her business and increase her capital.

loans.use: To purchase prepaid telephone cards for resale.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar, de 35 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo que realiza Cesar es el cultivo de papa y arveja, todas las mañanas comienza sus días cultivando y regando sus tierras, los ánimos que posee lo ayudan mucho en esta labor, ya que es una actividad que necesita de esfuerzo físico, pero él sabe que ningún esfuerzo esta de más. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, ya que siente que los meses de trabajo lo están recompensando, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Con el tiempo, desea juntar el dinero necesario y comprarse un auto, con el cual pueda transportar sus cultivos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte lo ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y motivo por el cual es muy respetado por sus compañeras de grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono, ya que desea mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en: Cesar, who is 35 years old, is a simple and hardworking man. He lives in his own home, and what he hopes for most is to improve his quality of life. Cesar works growing potatoes and peas. Each morning he starts his day tending and watering his lands. The spirit he has for his work helps him greatly, as it requires much physical effort. He knows that no effort is too great. What he enjoys most is harvesting the produce, because he feels that his hard work is paying off. He has been working in this field for 10 years, and the most difficult part is transporting his crops to the market in Tarma. In time, he plans to save up the money necessary to purchase a car so he can transport his produce. This is Cesar's 8th credit with MFP, and this support has been very helpful to him in developing his business. He is a very responsible and motived member of his communal bank, for which he is respected by his peers. With the funds requested, he will purchase fertilizer, as he wants to increase the productivity of his land.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
La señora Lili es socia de uno de los bancos comunales que maneja Manuela Ramos  en este caso es El paraíso. Distrito de calleria departamento Ucayali. A sus 51 años casada y su esposo  con trabajos ocasionales, teniendo que mantener a 4 hijos.  Ella  con el préstamo que le dio Manuela Ramos   puso  una pequeña vulcanizadora para que su esposo pueda generar ingresos a su hogar.
Ahora la señora Lili y su esposo se dedican a trabajar juntos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y pagar los estudios de sus hijos,  su negocio es a tiempo completo por la demanda que tiene el vulcanizado de llantas. 
 Con el ultimo préstamo de s/. 1500 soles que Manuela Ramos le hizo  va comprar repuestos para motos y motokar,  por unidades como son: cámaras, rodajes, cadenas, pernos catalinas cadenas y lubricantes.  
La señora Lili  está contenta  porque su negocio ha logrado unir a su familia y están viendo cómo podrían seguir mejorando el servicio que brindan.
El mayor de sus hijos también trabaja con ellos en su vulcanizadora y es el que está en la foto
texts.en:
Lili is a member of the El Paraiso community bank which is one of several served by Manuela Ramos in the Calleria district, Department of Ucayali. She is 51 and her husband does odd jobs while trying to maintain 4 children. With her previous loan from Manuela Ramos she started a small tire repair shop so that her husband could generate income for the household. Today Lili and her husband work together to meet household expenses and pay for their children's schooling.

The demand for tire repair means that it is a full time job. With this loan for 2500 Soles made by Manuela Ramos, she will buy replacement parts for motorcycles and motorcycle-taxis such as: gears, chains, bolts, spotlights, and lubricants. 

Lili is happy because the business has brought the family together and they are trying to improve their service. The eldest son will also start working with them and is next to her in the photo.

loans.use: Purchase replacement parts

loans.name: Guzman

texts.es: Guzmán, de 37 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Trabajando todos los días arduamente en sus cultivos, Guzmán trata de cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, con mucho esfuerzo siembra semestralmente papa y arveja, los cuales venden en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plaga de insectos, lleva 17 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar sus cultivos hasta el lugar donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. En adelante espera mejorar la calidad de sus productos y así obtener mejores precios. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultor. En su banco comunal es un socio muy participativo y solidario. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la productividad de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Guzmán, 37, is an unassuming, hard working man who lives in his own house and what he most desires is to improve his quality of life.  Working very hard every day on his crops he tries to change the daily life he currently lives.  With much effort he plants potatoes and peas every six months which are then sold at Tarma’s wholesale market because that’s where he gets the best prices for them.

What he likes best about his work is protecting his crops from insect infestations.  He has been a farmer for 17 years and considers the most difficult part of the work to be transporting his crops to the sales site because the sacks he has to carry are quite heavy.  In the future he’d like to improve the quality of his products thus obtaining better prices.

This is his 8th loan with MFP.  He feels that the loan will be very beneficial for his growth as a farmer.  He is a very active and supportive member of his communal bank.

He will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more manure and fertilizers to improve the productivity of his fields.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Kely Aurora

texts.es:
KELY AURORA DIA N.
La señora Kelly  socia del banco comunal  luchando por nosotras, distrito yarinacocha, departamento Ucayali, tiene 47 años de edad casada y un hijo a su cargo, para ayudar a la economía del hogar decidió invertir en la compra de chatarra que es un negocio muy rentable,  en estos tiempos, compra y vende ripio. Y también trabaja junto con su esposo.
Los préstamos que saca cada ciclo los invierte en la compra de ripio y cosas recicladas dependiendo de los meses el ripio llega tener un buen precio y tienen que aprovechar en comprar todo lo que pueda.
La señora Kelly trabaja en su casa y puede estar con su hijo que todavía necesita de sus cuidados.
El ultimo préstamo de s/. 3,000 lo invertirá comprando, 2 volqueta das de ripio y lo demás lo destinara a la compra de chatarra.
La señora Kelly  muestra su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por la confianza a su persona, al otorgarle los crédito,  y también porque tiene la oportunidad de seguir creciendo en sus negocios y le permite estar cerca a su familia.
texts.en:
KELY AURORA DIA N.

Nelly is a member of the “Luchando por Nosotras” (Fighting for Us) communal bank in Yarinacocha district, Ucayali department.  She is 47 years old, married and has a son in her care.  To help support the household’s economy she decided to buy scrap, which is a very profitable business.  Currently she’s a gravel merchant.  She works alongside her husband.

The loans she takes out each cycle are used to buy gravel and recyclables.  Depending on the month, gravel can attain a good price and they have to take advantage of this and buy all they can.

Kelly is able to work from home and care for her son who still needs her attention.

The s/.3, 000 loan will be used to buy two dump truck’s worth of gravel and the rest will be used to buy recyclables.

Kelly is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the trust they have placed in her by granting the loan and because it gives her the opportunity to continue growing in her business while keeping watch over her family.

loans.use: To buy gravel.

loans.name: Gladys Genara

texts.es:
Gladys de 45 años,  vende almuerzo a sus conocidos y vecinos, vive en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar esta ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Ella ha sido madre soltera con un niño que estudia en una Escuela Fiscal Por eso inicio la venta de comida desde su casa, vendiéndola a sus vecinos y conocidos ha podido incrementar sus ingresos para su negocio de comidas, trabajando desde las 07h00am hasta las 17h00pm haciendo platos como arroz con pollo, ensaladas, sopas de todo tipo, cremas de vegetales etc. 

Para que su negocio tenga un nivel de producción mas alto ella quiere comprar con el préstamo una cocina y víveres como arroz, vegetales y legumbre. En el futuro quiere tener su comedor en un local para tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Gladys, 45, sells meals to her acquaintances and neighbors.  She lives in a periurban area that has all basic utilities.  It is located along Guayaquil’s beltway, an area surrounded by an estuary.

She has been a single mother of a son who is a public school student.  This is why she started the food sales business; selling to her neighbors and acquaintances she has managed to increase income for her business.  She is open from 7am until 5pm making dishes like: chicken and rice, salads, all kinds of soups, vegetable cream soups, etc.

In order for her business to have a higher production level she wants to use the loan to buy a stove and foodstuffs like rice and vegetables.  In the future she’s like to have an eatery someplace so that she can earn higher income.

loans.use: To buy rice and a stove.
